translated: Bhadrapāla, therefore, listen to the coming, going, transference, and cessation of consciousness.

original: bzang skyong / dper na /🔽rlung gi khams gzugs can ma yin pa yin yang bstan du yod cing /
analyzed: bzang skyong / dper na / rlung gi khams gzugs can ma yin pa yin yang bstan du yod cing /
translated: Bhadrapāla, it is like this:🔽The wind element is formless, yet it appears as form,

original: gzung du yod pa dag las gzugs su snang ngo //
analyzed: gzung du yod pa dag las gzugs su snang ngo //
translated: and is perceptible and graspable.

original: de la bstan du yod pa ni shing 'gul zhing g-yo ba dang / sgra skad 'ur 'ur po'i sgra 'byin pa dang / grang ba dang / dro ba'i reg pas tshor ba skyed pa yin yang /
analyzed: de la bstan du yod pa ni shing 'gul zhing g-yo ba dang / sgra skad 'ur 'ur po'i sgra 'byin pa dang / grang ba dang / dro ba'i reg pas tshor ba skyed pa yin yang /
translated: It is visible in that it moves and shakes, makes a loud roaring sound, and produces a sensation of cold and heat.

original: de la rkang lag dang / mig dang / gdong dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rkang lag dang / mig dang / gdong dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But in it, one does not perceive hands, feet, eyes, or a face.

original: sngo sangs dang / dkar ba zhes kha dog lhag par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sngo sangs dang / dkar ba zhes kha dog lhag par mi dmigs so //
translated: One does not perceive any special color, such as blue or white.

original: bzang skyong / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang gzugs su mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang gzugs su mi dmigs shing /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, in the same way, this element of consciousness is not perceived as form.

original: gzugs su snang @145b bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs su snang @145b bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not appear as form.

original: khyod kyis rgyu'i bye brag dag gis rnam par shes pa'i khams rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis rgyu'i bye brag dag gis rnam par shes pa'i khams rtogs par bya'o //
translated: You should understand the element of consciousness through its specific causes.

original: de la rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What are those causes?

original: sems pa dang / tshor ba dang / chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: sems pa dang / tshor ba dang / chos kyi khams so //
translated: They are the elements of intention, sensation, and mental objects.

original: de la ji ltar na rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di lus yongs su btang nas /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di lus yongs su btang nas /
translated: How does this element of consciousness, having abandoned the body,

original: tshor ba dang / sems pa len ce na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / sems pa len ce na /
translated: take up sensation and intention?

original: dper na rlung gi khams kyis me tog gi dri bsdus nas 'phos te 'gro ba de las lha'i me tog gi dri 'di ngad ldang ngo zhes shes mod kyi /🔽rlung gi khams kyang me tog gi dri mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: dper na rlung gi khams kyis me tog gi dri bsdus nas 'phos te 'gro ba de las lha'i me tog gi dri 'di ngad ldang ngo zhes shes mod kyi / rlung gi khams kyang me tog gi dri mi 'dzin la /
translated: For example, the wind element collects the scent of a flower and carries it away. One can know that “The scent of a divine flower is wafting here.”🔽But the wind element does not hold the scent of the flower.

original: rlung gi khams med par yang me tog rnams kyi dri mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rlung gi khams med par yang me tog rnams kyi dri mi dmigs so //
translated: And without the wind element, the scent of the flower would not be perceived.

original: dri de yang gzugs can ma yin la /
analyzed: dri de yang gzugs can ma yin la /
translated: That scent is not physical.

original: rlung gi khams de yang gzugs can ma yin /
analyzed: rlung gi khams de yang gzugs can ma yin /
translated: And the wind element is not physical.

original: sna'i dbang po de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
analyzed: sna'i dbang po de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
translated: And the nose faculty is not physical.

original: bzang skyong / de bzhin du mi shi ba'i rnam par shes pa des tshor ba yongs su blangs shing sems pa kun du blangs te /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de bzhin du mi shi ba'i rnam par shes pa des tshor ba yongs su blangs shing sems pa kun du blangs te /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, in the same way, the consciousness of a dead person takes up feelings and takes up thoughts.

original: chos kyi khams yang dag par blangs nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro ste /
analyzed: chos kyi khams yang dag par blangs nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro ste /
translated: Having taken up the element of mental objects, it goes to the next world.

original: pha ma phrad pa las rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha ma phrad pa las rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Consciousness arises from the union of the parents.

original: rnam par shes pa skyes na tshor ba rnams dang / sems pa rnams 'du bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes na tshor ba rnams dang / sems pa rnams 'du bar 'gyur te /
translated: When consciousness arises, feelings and thoughts come together.

original: dper na / me tog gi dbang gis snas tshor la /
analyzed: dper na / me tog gi dbang gis snas tshor la /
translated: For example, due to the power of a flower, smell is sensed,🔽and due to the power of the nose, the smell is observed.

original: sna'i dbang gis dri dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang lus kyi dbang gis rlung gi rang bzhin gyi reg pa dmigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sna'i dbang gis dri dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang lus kyi dbang gis rlung gi rang bzhin gyi reg pa dmigs par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, due to the power of the body, the nature of wind is observed as touch,🔽and due to the power of wind, the smell of the flower arises.

original: rlung gi dbang gis me tog gi dri 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rlung gi dbang gis me tog gi dri 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: In the same way, due to the power of consciousness, feeling arises,

original: tshor ba'i dbang gis sems pa 'byung bar @146a *//
analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang gis sems pa 'byung bar @146a *//
translated: and due to the power of feeling, intention arises.

original: 'gyur ro // sems pa'i dbang gis gang gis dge ba'am mi dge ba shes pa'i chos kyi khams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // sems pa'i dbang gis gang gis dge ba'am mi dge ba shes pa'i chos kyi khams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Due to the power of intention, the element of mental objects is generated, by which virtue or nonvirtue is known.

original: dper na / ri mo mkhan rtsig pa dang / shing leb shin tu byi dor byas pa la ci 'dod pa bzhin du las byed de /
analyzed: dper na / ri mo mkhan rtsig pa dang / shing leb shin tu byi dor byas pa la ci 'dod pa bzhin du las byed de /
translated: For example, a painter works on a wall or a very smooth wooden board as he wishes,

original: las la blo sbyangs pas ci 'dod pa bzhin du gzugs rnams mngon par 'grub par byed kyang /
analyzed: las la blo sbyangs pas ci 'dod pa bzhin du gzugs rnams mngon par 'grub par byed kyang /
translated: and because he has trained his mind in his work, he creates various forms as he wishes.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa de yang gzugs can ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa de yang gzugs can ma yin la /
translated: However, his consciousness is not physical.

original: rnam par shes pa gzugs can ma yin pas kyang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzugs can ma yin pas kyang /
translated: Since consciousness is not physical,🔽it can create various physical forms.

original: gzugs sna tshogs mngon par 'grub par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams gzugs can ma yin pa 'dis /
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs mngon par 'grub par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams gzugs can ma yin pa 'dis /
translated: In the same way, this formless consciousness element

original: gzugs kyi lus drug mngon par 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi lus drug mngon par 'grub par byed de /
translated: creates the six physical bodies.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mig gi rkyen gyis gzugs mthong la /
analyzed: mig gi rkyen gyis gzugs mthong la /
translated: The eye condition sees forms.

original: rnam par shes pa mig la brten pa gang yin pa de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mig la brten pa gang yin pa de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
translated: The consciousness that depends on the eye is also not physical.

original: rna ba'i rkyen gyis sgra ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i rkyen gyis sgra ste /
translated: The ear condition hears sounds.

original: de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
translated: That is also not physical.

original: sna'i rkyen gyis dri ste /
analyzed: sna'i rkyen gyis dri ste /
translated: The nose condition smells smells.

original: de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
translated: That is also not physical.

original: lce'i rkyen gyis ro ste /
analyzed: lce'i rkyen gyis ro ste /
translated: The tongue condition tastes tastes.

original: de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
translated: That is also not physical.

original: lus kyi rkyen gyi reg bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rkyen gyi reg bya ste /
translated: The body condition feels touchables.

original: de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzugs can ma yin no //
translated: That is also not physical.

original: chos kyi skye mched kyang gzugs can ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched kyang gzugs can ma yin no //
translated: The phenomena source is also not physical.

original: rab tu shes pa gang yin pa de yang gzugs can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu shes pa gang yin pa de yang gzugs can ma yin pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that knows that is also not physical.

original: de bas na spyod yul rnams kyang gzugs can ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na spyod yul rnams kyang gzugs can ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the objects of experience should be seen as formless.🔽In the same way, this element of consciousness should be seen as formless.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang gzugs can ma yin par blta bar @146b bya'o; ;ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis lus yongs su btang nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang gzugs can ma yin par blta bar @146b bya'o; ;ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis lus yongs su btang nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro zhe na /
translated: How does this element of consciousness leave the body and go to the next world?

original: bzang skyong / 'dir 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe las zad pas tshe 'gag pa na /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'dir 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe las zad pas tshe 'gag pa na /
translated: Bhadrapāla, at the time of death, when the life force ceases due to the exhaustion of karma,

original: las kyi sgrib pas zin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di 'pho bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pas zin pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di 'pho bar 'gyur te /
translated: this element of consciousness, bound by karmic obscurations, transfers.

original: dper na / dgra bcom pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams de khong bar 'gag nas yongs su 'phyan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / dgra bcom pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i khams de khong bar 'gag nas yongs su 'phyan pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the element of consciousness of an arhat who has entered the absorption of cessation ceases internally and does not wander,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang skye ba po shi ba'i lus yongs su btang zhing khams rnams bor nas dran pa stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang skye ba po shi ba'i lus yongs su btang zhing khams rnams bor nas dran pa stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: in the same way, this element of consciousness, having abandoned the body of the dying person and cast off the elements, becomes powerful in recollection.

original: 'di ltar bdag ni mchod sbyin gyis byin zhes bya ba de nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag ni mchod sbyin gyis byin zhes bya ba de nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, I am the one called ‘sacrificer.’

original: lus kyi tshor ba dang / yid kyi tshor ba dang / tshor ba rnam pa gnyis kyis zin to snyam du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba dang / yid kyi tshor ba dang / tshor ba rnam pa gnyis kyis zin to snyam du rab tu shes te /
translated: I am the one who experiences the two kinds of sensations: bodily and mental.”

original: de 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe ni lus kyi tshor ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe ni lus kyi tshor ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he dies, he will experience bodily sensations.

original: shi nas ni yid kyi tshor ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas ni yid kyi tshor ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: After death, he will experience mental sensations.

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: “What is the meaning of ‘consciousness’ (Skt. vijñāna)?

original: sa bon gyis lus kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub par byed la /
analyzed: sa bon gyis lus kyi myu gu mngon par 'grub par byed la /
translated: The seed produces the sprout of the body.

original: sems pas shes pa dran pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems pas shes pa dran pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind obtains the memory of consciousness.

original: de bas na sa bon dang / shes pa la rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sa bon dang / shes pa la rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the seed and consciousness are called ‘consciousness.’

original: gzhan yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas shes pa de rtogs pas na de'i phyir rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas shes pa de rtogs pas na de'i phyir rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, consciousness is called ‘consciousness’ because it cognizes the sensations of pleasure and pain.”

original: gzhan yang de dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rig pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i spyod yul shes pas na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rig pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i spyod yul shes pas na /
translated: Moreover, they know what is virtuous and nonvirtuous, and they know the domain of what is virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽sa bon gyis myu gu @147a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o // sa bon gyis myu gu @147a *//
translated: Moreover, it is called consciousness because it is aware of virtue and nonvirtue, and because it is aware of the domain of virtue and nonvirtue.

original: bskyed pa bzhin du lus 'grub pas de'i phyir yang rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa bzhin du lus 'grub pas de'i phyir yang rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called consciousness because it is the seed that produces the body, just as a sprout is produced from a seed.

original: bzang skyong / gzhan yang ci ltar rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis lus yongs su btang nas 'pho zhing 'gro bar 'gyur zhes khyod kyis smras pa de ni /
analyzed: bzang skyong / gzhan yang ci ltar rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis lus yongs su btang nas 'pho zhing 'gro bar 'gyur zhes khyod kyis smras pa de ni /
translated: Moreover, Bhadrapāla, you asked, “How does the element of consciousness leave the body and depart?”

original: dper na / me long gi gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / 'jim pa la rgyas btab pa'i 'bur bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / me long gi gzugs brnyan lta bu dang / 'jim pa la rgyas btab pa'i 'bur bzhin no //
translated: It is like a reflection in a mirror or a seal imprint in clay.

original: dper na / nyi ma shar na rab rib dang mun pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma shar na rab rib dang mun pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: For example, when the sun rises, darkness and obscurity disappear.

original: nyi ma med par gyur na yang mun pa 'byung bar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: nyi ma med par gyur na yang mun pa 'byung bar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Even when the sun has set, darkness does not appear.

original: mun pa de'i gnas ther zug pa'am /
analyzed: mun pa de'i gnas ther zug pa'am /
translated: But the abode of darkness is not permanent,

original: ther zug pa ma yin pa yang med la; mun pa de la yang gzugs dang / tshor ba mi snang ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ther zug pa ma yin pa yang med la; mun pa de la yang gzugs dang / tshor ba mi snang ba de bzhin du /
translated: It is not that there is no darkness, but that form and feeling do not appear in that darkness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang lus skyes nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang lus skyes nas /
translated: In the same way, this consciousness element is born in the body,

original: mun pa bzhin du lus la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mun pa bzhin du lus la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: and like darkness, it abides in the body.

original: mis kyang rnam par shes pa mi mthong la /
analyzed: mis kyang rnam par shes pa mi mthong la /
translated: People do not see consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang lus 'di 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang lus 'di 'dzin par byed do //
translated: but the consciousness element holds on to this body.🔽For example, a child in a mother’s womb does not know, ‘The one who is carrying me is a woman,’

original: dper na / bud med kyi mngal na bu gnas pa la ci bdag gi lto na 'dug pa 'di khye'u 'am /
analyzed: dper na / bud med kyi mngal na bu gnas pa la ci bdag gi lto na 'dug pa 'di khye'u 'am /
translated: or ‘This child in my womb is a boy,’🔽or ‘It is a girl,’

original: bu mo'am / sngo sangs sam /
analyzed: bu mo'am / sngo sangs sam /
translated: or ‘It is blue,’🔽or ‘It is white,’

original: dkar ram / ser ram /🔽dbang po tshang ba'am /
analyzed: dkar ram / ser ram / dbang po tshang ba'am /
translated: or ‘It is yellow,’🔽or ‘It has complete faculties,’

original: dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang ba ma yin pa'am /
translated: or ‘It has incomplete faculties,’

original: rkang lag mnyam pa yin par mi shes la /
analyzed: rkang lag mnyam pa yin par mi shes la /
translated: or ‘Its arms and legs are even.’

original: lto'i mngal na gnas pa de yang kha zas ha cang tsha bas 'gul zhing rig la /
analyzed: lto'i mngal na gnas pa de yang kha zas ha cang tsha bas 'gul zhing rig la /
translated: And that child in the womb moves around because of the mother’s eating and drinking, and it is aware.

original: tshor bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / brkyang ba dang / bskum pa dang / mig @147b 'dzum pa dang / 'byed pa dang / las thams cad yongs su spyad cing /
analyzed: tshor bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / brkyang ba dang / bskum pa dang / mig @147b 'dzum pa dang / 'byed pa dang / las thams cad yongs su spyad cing /
translated: Just as with the elements of feeling, this element of consciousness also comes and goes, extends and contracts, blinks and opens the eyes, and engages in all actions.

original: rgod pa dang / gtam dang / bsam pa bskyed pa'i rang bzhin can lus la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa la bdag gi lus la rnam par shes pa gnas pa 'di rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig snyam du sems can rnams kyis mi shes so //
analyzed: rgod pa dang / gtam dang / bsam pa bskyed pa'i rang bzhin can lus la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa la bdag gi lus la rnam par shes pa gnas pa 'di rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig snyam du sems can rnams kyis mi shes so //
translated: It is the nature of consciousness to be agitated, to speak, and to give rise to thoughts. The consciousness that resides in the body is not understood by sentient beings to be of such a nature.

original: bzang skyong / gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni shin tu yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / dngos po thams cad la chub pa yin la /
analyzed: bzang skyong / gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni shin tu yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / dngos po thams cad la chub pa yin la /
translated: “Moreover, Bhadrapāla, this element of consciousness is extremely refined and is aware of all things.

original: dngos po rnams kyis kyang gos pa med do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyis kyang gos pa med do //
translated: It is not sullied by things.

original: bzang skyong / 'di na rnam par shes pa ni bsgos pa yin te /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di na rnam par shes pa ni bsgos pa yin te /
translated: Bhadrapāla, here consciousness is infused

original: dbang po drug po rnams dang / dbang po drug gi spyod yul rnams dang / khams bzhi po rnams dang / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams dang / bzang skyong /
analyzed: dbang po drug po rnams dang / dbang po drug gi spyod yul rnams dang / khams bzhi po rnams dang / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams dang / bzang skyong /
translated: the six sense faculties, the objects of the six sense faculties, the four elements, the five appropriated aggregates, Bhadrapāla,

original: 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa la bsgo bar bya ba yin par blta'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa la bsgo bar bya ba yin par blta'o //
translated: should be seen as the ones who are directed by consciousness.

original: dper na / shing gi 'khrul 'khor phur bu gcig gis gzugs byas pa de bya ba thams cad byed de /
analyzed: dper na / shing gi 'khrul 'khor phur bu gcig gis gzugs byas pa de bya ba thams cad byed de /
translated: For example, a wooden machine made with a single nail can perform all kinds of actions,

original: rgyug pa dang / mchong ba dang / gar byed pa dang / bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs dag la 'jug na; bzang skyong /
analyzed: rgyug pa dang / mchong ba dang / gar byed pa dang / bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs dag la 'jug na; bzang skyong /
translated: such as running, jumping, dancing, and engaging in various activities.

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Bhadrapāla, what do you think?

original: 'khrul 'khor de gang gi dbang gis 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor de gang gi dbang gis 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: By whose power does that machine move?”

original: bzang skyong gis gsol pa /
analyzed: bzang skyong gis gsol pa /
translated: Bhadrapāla replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bkas rmas pa de'i rgyus ni bdag gis ma 'tshal to //
analyzed: bkas rmas pa de'i rgyus ni bdag gis ma 'tshal to //
translated: I do not understand the reason for that question.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: bzang skyong / 'khrul 'khor de ni las kyi dbang gis 'jug ste /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'khrul 'khor de ni las kyi dbang gis 'jug ste /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, that machine moves by the power of karma.

original: las de yang gzugs can ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa las mngon @148a *//🔽par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: las de yang gzugs can ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa las mngon @148a *// par 'grub pa'o //
translated: And that action is not physical, but is accomplished through consciousness.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi 'khrul 'khor 'di yang rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi 'khrul 'khor 'di yang rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis 'byung ste /
translated: In the same way, this machine of the body is produced through the power of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni lus sna tshogs la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni lus sna tshogs la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: This element of consciousness enters into various bodies.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni lus skyed par byed pa'i phyir byed pa po yang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni lus skyed par byed pa'i phyir byed pa po yang yin no //
translated: This element of consciousness is the agent because it produces the body.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni lus kyi khams la brten pa'i phyir mi zad pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni lus kyi khams la brten pa'i phyir mi zad pa yang yin no //
translated: This element of consciousness is inexhaustible because it is based on the elements of the body.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni sngon gyi lus kyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i phyir blo phun sum tshogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni sngon gyi lus kyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i phyir blo phun sum tshogs pa yang yin no //
translated: This element of consciousness is endowed with intelligence because it remembers the former abodes of the body.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni nyi ma'i 'od zer dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni nyi ma'i 'od zer dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: This element of consciousness should be seen as being like the sun’s rays.

original: dper na / nyi ma'i 'od zer ni dri nga ba dag dang / mi gtsang ba dag dang / ro dag la yang 'bab ste /
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma'i 'od zer ni dri nga ba dag dang / mi gtsang ba dag dang / ro dag la yang 'bab ste /
translated: For example, the light of the sun shines on foul things, on impurities, and on corpses.

original: 'on kyang de dag la dri des gos par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag la dri des gos par mi 'gyur la /
translated: But the light is not defiled by those smells.

original: nyi ma yang dri nga ba bor te yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: nyi ma yang dri nga ba bor te yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: And the sun does not abandon its light because of foul smells.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang phyi sa dang / snyag snyig za ba'i khyi dang / phag gi skye gnas dag tu yang skye ba yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang phyi sa dang / snyag snyig za ba'i khyi dang / phag gi skye gnas dag tu yang skye ba yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: In the same way, this consciousness element takes up a rebirth in the wombs of dogs and pigs, which eat feces and garbage.

original: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams la spyod pa ngan pa de dag gis gos pa med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams la spyod pa ngan pa de dag gis gos pa med do //
translated: But the consciousness element is not defiled by those bad actions.

original: bzang skyong / gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni lus yongs su btang nas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: bzang skyong / gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni lus yongs su btang nas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: “Moreover, Bhadrapāla, this consciousness element, having abandoned the body, follows after virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de yang ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams gzugs can ma yin pa 'dis lus 'dir bor nas bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams gzugs can ma yin pa 'dis lus 'dir bor nas bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: This formless consciousness element, having abandoned this body, takes up merit and demerit.

original: @148b dper na /
analyzed: @148b dper na /
translated: For example,

original: rlung gi khams brag gi phrag nas byung nas /
analyzed: rlung gi khams brag gi phrag nas byung nas /
translated: the wind element arises from the side of a cliff

original: shing tsam pa ka dang phrad de spos shin tu dri zhim po khyer nas /
analyzed: shing tsam pa ka dang phrad de spos shin tu dri zhim po khyer nas /
translated: and, having encountered a campaka tree, carries the extremely fragrant scent

original: yang dri nga ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / ro'i dri yang khyer te 'gro la /
analyzed: yang dri nga ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / ro'i dri yang khyer te 'gro la /
translated: and also carries bad smells, impurities, and the smell of corpses.

original: bzang skyong; de las gang ches shas che ba de'i dri dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzang skyong; de las gang ches shas che ba de'i dri dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Bhadrapāla, it is the scent of whichever is most prevalent that it carries.

original: ji ltar rlung gi khams de dri rnam pa gnyis khyer te 'gro yang /
analyzed: ji ltar rlung gi khams de dri rnam pa gnyis khyer te 'gro yang /
translated: Just as the wind element carries two types of scents,

original: rlung gi khams de yang gzugs can ma yin la /
analyzed: rlung gi khams de yang gzugs can ma yin la /
translated: the wind element is not physical,

original: dri de gnyis kyang gzugs can ma yin pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang lus las 'phos te /
analyzed: dri de gnyis kyang gzugs can ma yin pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang lus las 'phos te /
translated: and those two scents are also not physical. In the same way, this consciousness element also moves from the body,

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba khyer nas 'pho ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba khyer nas 'pho ste /
translated: carrying virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de ltar na de'i 'pho ba dmigs so //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i 'pho ba dmigs so //
translated: Thus, its movement is observed.

original: dper na / rmi lam na mis dngos po thams cad shes kyang lus des mal na 'dug par mi shes pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / rmi lam na mis dngos po thams cad shes kyang lus des mal na 'dug par mi shes pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, although a person in a dream knows all things, that body does not know that it is lying in bed.

original: bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can rnams rmi lam rmi ba bzhin du 'pho zhing 'gro yang rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang lkog ma'i mid pa rnams nas kyang mi 'byung /
analyzed: bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can rnams rmi lam rmi ba bzhin du 'pho zhing 'gro yang rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang lkog ma'i mid pa rnams nas kyang mi 'byung /
translated: Sentient beings who are approaching merit will pass away and depart like one who has had a dream, and yet this element of consciousness will not emerge from the throat or the gullet.

original: bu ga rnams nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: bu ga rnams nas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It will not be through the orifices.

original: de ni khong bu dang gsab rnams mi 'tshol lo //
analyzed: de ni khong bu dang gsab rnams mi 'tshol lo //
translated: It will not seek out the intestines and the bowels.

original: de nas bzang skyong gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /🔽ji ltar na bya gag gi sgo nga'am /
analyzed: de nas bzang skyong gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das / ji ltar na bya gag gi sgo nga'am /
translated: Then Bhadrapāla touched the feet of the Blessed One and said to him, “Blessed One,🔽how is it that chicks die inside eggs

original: ngang pa'i sgo nga ma phrugs pa shun pa ma rdol par sgo nga'i nang nas bye'u phrug rnams 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: ngang pa'i sgo nga ma phrugs pa shun pa ma rdol par sgo nga'i nang nas bye'u phrug rnams 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ba lags /
translated: without the eggs of the birds or the geese hatching or breaking open?

original: ji ltar na bu ga ma brtol bar rnam par shes pa 'pho bar 'gyur /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na bu ga ma brtol bar rnam par shes pa 'pho bar 'gyur / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: How does consciousness pass away without the orifices being opened?”

original: dper na / @149a *//
analyzed: dper na / @149a *//
translated: The Blessed One said, “For example,

original: til 'bru tsam pa ka'i me tog gis bsgos nas legs par brdungs te btsir ba las til mar byung ba ni tsam pa ka'i til mar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: til 'bru tsam pa ka'i me tog gis bsgos nas legs par brdungs te btsir ba las til mar byung ba ni tsam pa ka'i til mar zhes bya'o //
translated: It is like this: sesame seeds are dyed with the color of campaka flowers, and when they are well pounded and pressed, sesame oil comes out, which is called campaka sesame oil.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na; dri des kyang til 'bru ma brtol bzhin du dri zhim pos bsgos te 'phos te 'gro yang /
analyzed: dper na; dri des kyang til 'bru ma brtol bzhin du dri zhim pos bsgos te 'phos te 'gro yang /
translated: for example, the sesame seeds are not broken, and the fragrance is transferred while being dyed with a good fragrance.

original: dri des snum gyi ro myong bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dri des snum gyi ro myong bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: However, the fragrance does not experience the taste of the oil.

original: 'bru'i rkyen dang me tog dang phrad pas til mar dri dang 'dris pa'i dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bru'i rkyen dang me tog dang phrad pas til mar dri dang 'dris pa'i dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: When the sesame seeds meet the conditions of flowers and fire, the sesame oil becomes an object mixed with fragrance.

original: 'on kyang til gyi 'bru de la me tog gi dri de gseb nas 'gro ba ni med la /
analyzed: 'on kyang til gyi 'bru de la me tog gi dri de gseb nas 'gro ba ni med la /
translated: However, the fragrance of the flowers does not go inside the sesame seeds.

original: de'i rkyen gyis dri de 'pho zhing 'gro ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang me tog gi dri bzhin du sgo nga'i shun pa ma brtol bar 'pho zhing 'gro ste /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis dri de 'pho zhing 'gro ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang me tog gi dri bzhin du sgo nga'i shun pa ma brtol bar 'pho zhing 'gro ste /
translated: By that condition, the fragrance is transferred and goes. In the same way, this consciousness element, like the fragrance of a flower, is transferred and goes without breaking the shell of the egg.

original: de'i 'pho ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'pho ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Its transference should be seen in the same way.

original: gzhan yang de'i 'pho ba ni nyi ma dang / me shel dang / bsreg bya dang 'dra bar yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i 'pho ba ni nyi ma dang / me shel dang / bsreg bya dang 'dra bar yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the transmigration of consciousness should be understood as being like the sun, a magnifying glass, and something combustible.

original: gzhan yang sa bon 'pho ba dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa bon 'pho ba dang 'dra ste /
translated: Moreover, it is like the transmigration of a seed.

original: sa phyogs gang du sa bon btab na /
analyzed: sa phyogs gang du sa bon btab na /
translated: When a seed is planted in a particular place,

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams gcig pa kho na las sa bon de sa la brten cing sdong bu dang / lo ma sngon por 'grub pa /
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams gcig pa kho na las sa bon de sa la brten cing sdong bu dang / lo ma sngon por 'grub pa /
translated: from the single elements of earth, water, fire, and wind, that seed grows into a stalk and green leaves,

original: me tog dkar po'am /
analyzed: me tog dkar po'am /
translated: white flowers,

original: sngon po'am / dmar por snang ba'am /
analyzed: sngon po'am / dmar por snang ba'am /
translated: blue, red,

original: kha dog sna tshogs sam /
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs sam /
translated: or various colors,🔽and ripens into a different taste.

original: smin pa'i ro tha dad par 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams chos kyi khams gcig pu 'di las srid par skye ba thams cad du lus sngo sangs sam /🔽dkar ba'am / ser @149b ba'am /
analyzed: smin pa'i ro tha dad par 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams chos kyi khams gcig pu 'di las srid par skye ba thams cad du lus sngo sangs sam / dkar ba'am / ser @149b ba'am /
translated: In the same way, from this single element of consciousness and the element of mental objects, all bodies are born in all existences, blue,🔽white,🔽yellow,🔽red,

original: khra bo'am / dmar po'am /🔽rang bzhin gyis mnyen por skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khra bo'am / dmar po'am /🔽rang bzhin gyis mnyen por skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or naturally soft.

original: bzang skyong / gzhan yang 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di lus yongs su btang nas sa bon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzang skyong / gzhan yang 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di lus yongs su btang nas sa bon du 'gyur te /
translated: Bhadrapāla, moreover, at the time of death, this element of consciousness abandons the body and becomes a seed.

original: bdag nyid rkang lag dang ldan par shes so //
analyzed: bdag nyid rkang lag dang ldan par shes so //
translated: It thinks, “I have feet and hands.”

original: 'on kyang de la yan lag dang nying lag ni med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la yan lag dang nying lag ni med do //
translated: However, it does not have major or minor body parts.

original: de yang sa'i khams yongs su btang nas chos kyi khams yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: de yang sa'i khams yongs su btang nas chos kyi khams yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: Moreover, having abandoned the earth element, it takes hold of the element of dharmas.

original: chos kyi khams de yang dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: chos kyi khams de yang dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: That element of dharmas is concomitant with mindfulness.

original: dran pa de yang spyod yul gyi stobs dang ldan no //
analyzed: dran pa de yang spyod yul gyi stobs dang ldan no //
translated: That mindfulness has the power of the domain.

original: chos kyi khams dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i len pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi khams dran pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i len pa'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa yin te /
translated: The cause of the appropriation of the element of dharmas concomitant with mindfulness is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par yang chos kyi khams mi dmigs la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par yang chos kyi khams mi dmigs la /
translated: Apart from consciousness, the element of dharmas is not apprehended.

original: chos kyi khams ma gtogs par yang rnam par shes pa'i khams med do //
analyzed: chos kyi khams ma gtogs par yang rnam par shes pa'i khams med do //
translated: Apart from the element of dharmas, there is no element of consciousness.

original: rlung gi khams ni rnam par shes pa de'i rjes su 'jug go /
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni rnam par shes pa de'i rjes su 'jug go /
translated: The element of wind follows that consciousness.

original: gzhan yang lha'i khams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang lha'i khams 'di lta ste /
translated: Furthermore, the following elements follow:

original: dran pa'i khams dang / tshor ba'i khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams gang yin pa rnams kyang rjes su 'jug go /
analyzed: dran pa'i khams dang / tshor ba'i khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams gang yin pa rnams kyang rjes su 'jug go /
translated: the element of recollection, the element of sensation, the element of phenomena, and the element of form.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal nas bcom ldan 'das la bzang skyong gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal nas bcom ldan 'das la bzang skyong gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having been thus addressed, Bhadrapāla said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa de gzugs can lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa de gzugs can lags /
translated: how is that consciousness material?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: bzang skyong / 'di la nang gi gzugs dang / phyi rol gyi gzugs yod de /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di la nang gi gzugs dang / phyi rol gyi gzugs yod de /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, here there is inner form and outer form.

original: de la nang gi gzugs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang gi gzugs gang zhe na /
translated: What is inner form?

original: zin pa'i mig gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi gzugs so //
analyzed: zin pa'i mig gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi gzugs so //
translated: The eye that is grasped is outer form.

original: mig gi rnam par @150a *//
analyzed: mig gi rnam par @150a *//
translated: The eye consciousness

original: shes pa gang yin pa de ni nang gi gzugs so //
analyzed: shes pa gang yin pa de ni nang gi gzugs so //
translated: is inner form.

original: rna ba gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi gzugs so //
analyzed: rna ba gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi gzugs so //
translated: The ear is outer form.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni nang gi gzugs so //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni nang gi gzugs so //
translated: The ear consciousness is inner form.

original: sna gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi gzugs so //
analyzed: sna gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi gzugs so //
translated: The nose is an external form.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni nang gi gzugs so //
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni nang gi gzugs so //
translated: The nose consciousness is an internal form.

original: lce gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi gzugs so //🔽lce'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni nang gi gzugs so; ;lus gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi gzugs so //
analyzed: lce gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi gzugs so // lce'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni nang gi gzugs so; ;lus gang yin pa de ni phyi rol gyi gzugs so //
translated: The tongue is an external form.🔽The tongue consciousness is an internal form. The body is an external form.

original: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni nang gi gzugs so //
analyzed: lus kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni nang gi gzugs so //
translated: The tactile consciousness is an internal form.

original: bzang skyong / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di lta ste /
translated: Bhadrapāla, it is like this:

original: dper na / mi dmus long zhig nub mo gnyid kyi dbang du gyur pa na /
analyzed: dper na / mi dmus long zhig nub mo gnyid kyi dbang du gyur pa na /
translated: For example, a blind man in the dark falls asleep.

original: lha'i gzugs rkang lag mnyam shing mchog tu yid du 'ong bdag mthong la /
analyzed: lha'i gzugs rkang lag mnyam shing mchog tu yid du 'ong bdag mthong la /
translated: He sees the forms of the gods, with their equal feet and supremely delightful bodies.

original: des de dag mthong nas mchog tu dga' ba bskyed de /
analyzed: des de dag mthong nas mchog tu dga' ba bskyed de /
translated: Having seen them, he generates supreme joy.

original: gnyid log pa las sad pa dang gzugs de dag ma mthong la /
analyzed: gnyid log pa las sad pa dang gzugs de dag ma mthong la /
translated: When he wakes up from sleep, he does not see those forms.

original: nam langs nas 'di skad du /
analyzed: nam langs nas 'di skad du /
translated: When dawn breaks, he says this:

original: khyod nyon cig /
analyzed: khyod nyon cig /
translated: Listen!

original: mdang mtshan mo bdag gi rmi lam du bud med kyi gzugs mchog tu yid du 'ong ba dang / skyed mos tshal mi stong gis gang ba mthong ste /
analyzed: mdang mtshan mo bdag gi rmi lam du bud med kyi gzugs mchog tu yid du 'ong ba dang / skyed mos tshal mi stong gis gang ba mthong ste /
translated: Last night I dreamed of a woman of supreme beauty, and of a pleasure grove filled with a thousand people.

original: der bdag gis mi lus shin tu gzhon sha can lag pa glang po che mchog gi sna ltar rid ba /
analyzed: der bdag gis mi lus shin tu gzhon sha can lag pa glang po che mchog gi sna ltar rid ba /
translated: There I saw a very young man with arms as long as an elephant’s trunk,

original: thal gong yangs shing rgyas la /
analyzed: thal gong yangs shing rgyas la /
translated: with broad shoulders,

original: brang yangs shing mkhregs pa dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: brang yangs shing mkhregs pa dag mthong ngo //
translated: and a broad and firm chest.

original: zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: zhes smra zhing /
translated: He said this.🔽🔽

original: mi de dag gi lus kyi rgyan mdzes pa gang yin pa de dag bzlas la /
analyzed: mi de dag gi lus kyi rgyan mdzes pa gang yin pa de dag bzlas la /
translated: He described the beautiful ornaments on the bodies of those people.

original: de nas dmus long des mi de dag nyid kyi gzugs rnams ma mthong na /
analyzed: de nas dmus long des mi de dag nyid kyi gzugs rnams ma mthong na /
translated: Then, since the blind man did not see the forms of those people,

original: bzang skyong / 'di ji snyam @150b du sems /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di ji snyam @150b du sems /
translated: Bhadrapāla, what do you think?🔽How did that blind man see forms in his dream?

original: mi dmus long des rmi lam du gzugs rnams ji ltar mthong /
analyzed: mi dmus long des rmi lam du gzugs rnams ji ltar mthong /
translated: How can a blind man see forms in a dream?🔽

original: bzang skyong gis gsol pa /
analyzed: bzang skyong gis gsol pa /
translated: Bhadrapāla replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de'i slad du bdag la bka' stsal du gsol /
analyzed: de'i slad du bdag la bka' stsal du gsol /
translated: please explain this to me.🔽”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Bhadrapāla,

original: bzang skyong / de bas na nang gi mig shes pa dang ldan pas rmi lam du gzugs rnams mthong gi /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de bas na nang gi mig shes pa dang ldan pas rmi lam du gzugs rnams mthong gi /
translated: Bhadrapāla, therefore, it is the inner eye consciousness that sees forms in dreams,

original: sha'i mig gis ma yin no //
analyzed: sha'i mig gis ma yin no //
translated: not the physical eye.

original: ji ltar mi gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam du yud tsam zhig dran par 'byung ba bzhin du shi ba'i dran pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mi gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam du yud tsam zhig dran par 'byung ba bzhin du shi ba'i dran pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as a person who is asleep and dreaming remembers only for a moment, so too is the memory of death.

original: nang gi gzugs de yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi gzugs de yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The inner form should be seen in the same way.

original: bzang skyong / gzhan yang mi shi ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams de sa bon gyi khams bzhin du 'pho zhing 'gro ba ngas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bzang skyong / gzhan yang mi shi ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams de sa bon gyi khams bzhin du 'pho zhing 'gro ba ngas bshad par bya ste /
translated: Bhadrapāla, moreover, I will explain how the element of consciousness of a dead person transmigrates and moves on, like the element of a seed.

original: dper na / sa bon gyi khams sa gzhi la btab na /
analyzed: dper na / sa bon gyi khams sa gzhi la btab na /
translated: For example, when the element of a seed is planted in the ground,

original: khams bzhi po dag sdud par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang dran pa rab tu 'dzin cing tshor ba yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: khams bzhi po dag sdud par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang dran pa rab tu 'dzin cing tshor ba yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: it gathers the four elements. In the same way, this element of consciousness gathers up memory and grasps feelings.🔽It takes up virtue and nonvirtue,

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba yang rjes su bzung nas /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba yang rjes su bzung nas /
translated: and

original: lus yongs su btang ste 'pho zhing 'gro'o //
analyzed: lus yongs su btang ste 'pho zhing 'gro'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that, having taken on a body, transmigrates and goes.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa de dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par shes pa de dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: how does that consciousness take on virtue and nonvirtue?🔽Bhadrapāla,

original: bzang skyong / dper na /🔽nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga ni 'od nag po'am /
analyzed: bzang skyong / dper na / nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga ni 'od nag po'am /
translated: it is like this:

original: dkar po 'dzin te /🔽'od kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du nor bu rin po che de la 'byung zhing /
analyzed: dkar po 'dzin te / 'od kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du nor bu rin po che de la 'byung zhing /
translated: A padma-rāja jewel takes on either a black or a white light.🔽The light that appears in that jewel is of the nature of light.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid nor bu rin po che de la snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid nor bu rin po che de la snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: The nature of that light appears in that jewel.

original: gnas gang dang gang du 'phos pa de dang der kha dog dag snang ba de bzhin du rnam par @151a *//
analyzed: gnas gang dang gang du 'phos pa de dang der kha dog dag snang ba de bzhin du rnam par @151a *//
translated: Wherever it moves, wherever it goes, the colors appear there.

original: shes pa 'di dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su bzung nas 'pho zhing 'gro'o //
analyzed: shes pa 'di dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su bzung nas 'pho zhing 'gro'o //
translated: In the same way, this consciousness, having taken on virtue and nonvirtue, transmigrates and goes.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la bzang skyong gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la bzang skyong gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again, Bhadrapāla asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das; ji ltar na lus 'di la rnam par shes pa rtogs par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; ji ltar na lus 'di la rnam par shes pa rtogs par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: “Blessed One, how is consciousness realized in this body?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: bzang skyong / rnam par shes pa 'di bsags pa'am spungs par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bzang skyong / rnam par shes pa 'di bsags pa'am spungs par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: “Bhadrapāla, this consciousness is not observed as accumulated or heaped up.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di skye zhing 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di skye zhing 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this element of consciousness arises and ceases.

original: bzang skyong / dper na /
analyzed: bzang skyong / dper na /
translated: Bhadrapāla, it is like this:

original: sa bon las ni myu gu 'byung mod kyi sa bon rul pa las myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sa bon las ni myu gu 'byung mod kyi sa bon rul pa las myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: From a seed, a sprout does arise, but a sprout does not arise from a rotten seed.

original: sa bon nyams pa las kyang myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sa bon nyams pa las kyang myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor does a sprout arise from a damaged seed.

original: myu gu yang 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: myu gu yang 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: And yet, a sprout is produced.

original: bzang skyong / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽myu gu de'i sa bon sdong bu'am /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di ji snyam du sems / myu gu de'i sa bon sdong bu'am /
translated: Bhadrapāla, what do you think of this?🔽Is that sprout’s seed in the trunk,

original: lo ma 'am /
analyzed: lo ma 'am /
translated: or in the leaves,

original: sbubs gang na gnas /
analyzed: sbubs gang na gnas /
translated: or in the bud?

original: sa bon ni shing gi rtse mo na yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: sa bon ni shing gi rtse mo na yang mi gnas so //
translated: The seed is not in the top of the tree.

original: de bzhin du lus 'di la rnam par shes pa gang na yang mi gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus 'di la rnam par shes pa gang na yang mi gnas te /
translated: In the same way, consciousness is not located anywhere in this body.

original: mig mig la yang ma yin /
analyzed: mig mig la yang ma yin /
translated: It is not in the eyes,

original: rna ba la yang ma yin /
analyzed: rna ba la yang ma yin /
translated: nor in the ears,

original: sna'i dbang po la gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sna'i dbang po la gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it located in the nose.

original: sa bon gyis myu gu skye ba gang yin pa de ni sems pa chung ba yin no //
analyzed: sa bon gyis myu gu skye ba gang yin pa de ni sems pa chung ba yin no //
translated: The seed is the small intention.

original: mngal du skye ba de ni tshor ba chung ba yin no //
analyzed: mngal du skye ba de ni tshor ba chung ba yin no //
translated: The womb is the small sensation.

original: dper na / myu gu 'byung zhing dus tshigs dang ldan pa na me tog rnams 'grub ste /
analyzed: dper na / myu gu 'byung zhing dus tshigs dang ldan pa na me tog rnams 'grub ste /
translated: For example, when the sprout arises and the season is right, the flowers are produced.

original: me tog grub na 'bras bu 'grub pa yod pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis lus 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog grub na 'bras bu 'grub pa yod pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis lus 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the flowers are produced, the fruit is produced. In the same way, this consciousness element produces the body.

original: lus grub @151b ba na yan lag dang nying lag gang la yang rnam par shes pa mi gnas la /
analyzed: lus grub @151b ba na yan lag dang nying lag gang la yang rnam par shes pa mi gnas la /
translated: When the body is produced, the consciousness does not remain in any of the limbs or minor limbs.

original: rnam par shes pa med na yang lus skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med na yang lus skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And even without consciousness, the body would not be produced.

original: dper na / shing yongs su smin pa las sa bon 'byung la /
analyzed: dper na / shing yongs su smin pa las sa bon 'byung la /
translated: For example, a seed comes from a fully ripened tree,

original: yongs su ma smin pa las ma yin pa de bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe lus las rnam par shes pa 'di snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa las ma yin pa de bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe lus las rnam par shes pa 'di snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: not from an unripened one. In the same way, at the time of death, this consciousness appears from the body.

original: tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa /
analyzed: tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa /
translated: It is associated with sensation,

original: srid pas bsdams pa /
analyzed: srid pas bsdams pa /
translated: and is bound by craving.

original: dran pas yongs su bzung ba /
analyzed: dran pas yongs su bzung ba /
translated: It is held by mindfulness.

original: dge ba la dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa /
analyzed: dge ba la dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa /
translated: It is associated with the focus on virtue.

original: mi dge ba la mi dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa /
analyzed: mi dge ba la mi dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa /
translated: It is associated with the lack of focus on nonvirtue.

original: rlung gi khams kyis yongs su zin pa /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyis yongs su zin pa /
translated: It is sustained by the wind element.

original: shes pas mngon par brlan pa /
analyzed: shes pas mngon par brlan pa /
translated: It is moistened by consciousness.

original: rkyen la mngon du phyogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni pha ma phrad pa na skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen la mngon du phyogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni pha ma phrad pa na skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Consciousness that is directed toward conditions arises when the parents come together.

original: dper na / me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu phyis pa la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang yang /
analyzed: dper na / me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu phyis pa la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang yang /
translated: For example, the reflection of a face appears in a very clean mirror,

original: bzhin med par yang gzugs brnyan mi 'byung la /
analyzed: bzhin med par yang gzugs brnyan mi 'byung la /
translated: but without the face, the reflection does not appear.

original: me long med par yang gzugs brnyan mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: me long med par yang gzugs brnyan mi 'byung ste /
translated: And without the mirror, the reflection does not appear.

original: ji ltar bzhin dang me long phrad pa las gzugs brnyan 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar bzhin dang me long phrad pa las gzugs brnyan 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Just as the reflection arises from the coming together of the face and the mirror,

original: gzugs brnyan de yang gzugs can ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan de yang gzugs can ma yin la /
translated: that reflection is not a physical object.

original: de la tshor ba dang rab tu shes pa yang med /
analyzed: de la tshor ba dang rab tu shes pa yang med /
translated: It has no feeling or perception.

original: lus gang dang gang du bskyod pa de dang de nyid du gzugs brnyan 'pho zhing /
analyzed: lus gang dang gang du bskyod pa de dang de nyid du gzugs brnyan 'pho zhing /
translated: Wherever the body moves, the reflection moves.

original: ji lta bur lus smra ba dang / 'bod pa dang / 'gro ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang bar byed pa de bzhin du bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan yang 'gyur bar snang ngo //
analyzed: ji lta bur lus smra ba dang / 'bod pa dang / 'gro ba dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang bar byed pa de bzhin du bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan yang 'gyur bar snang ngo //
translated: Whatever the body does, the reflection does: it speaks, it cries out, it walks, it sits, it stretches out its arms.

original: bzang skyong / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, what do you think?

original: gang gi dbang gis gzugs brnyan de dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis gzugs brnyan de dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: What is it that makes the reflection appear?”

original: @152a *// bzang skyong gis gsol pa /
analyzed: @152a *// bzang skyong gis gsol pa /
translated: Bhadrapāla replied,

original: mi'i dbang po'i gzugs brnyan gda' ste /
analyzed: mi'i dbang po'i gzugs brnyan gda' ste /
translated: “The reflection of the lord of men appears.

original: de yang me long gi rkyen gyis bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan gda' la /
analyzed: de yang me long gi rkyen gyis bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan gda' la /
translated: And that reflection appears in the mirror due to the condition of the face.

original: bzhin gyi mdog ci 'dra ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba dang / dbang po tshang ba de nyid kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung lags so //
analyzed: bzhin gyi mdog ci 'dra ba dang / dbang po ma tshang ba dang / dbang po tshang ba de nyid kyi gzugs brnyan 'byung lags so //
translated: The reflection appears with the same complexion as the face, with the same incomplete or complete sense faculties.”

original: bzang skyong / ji ltar lus kyi dbang dang / me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi rkyen gyis gzugs brnyan 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: bzang skyong / ji ltar lus kyi dbang dang / me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi rkyen gyis gzugs brnyan 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, just as the reflection appears due to the condition of the body and the surface of the mirror,

original: rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis lus 'di tshor ba myong zhing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis lus 'di tshor ba myong zhing /
translated: This body is made to experience sensations by the power of consciousness.

original: 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / yid la byed pa 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / yid la byed pa 'grub par byed do //
translated: It is made to accomplish perceptions, volitions, and mental activities.

original: de la me long gang yin pa de ni pha ma phrad pa lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: de la me long gang yin pa de ni pha ma phrad pa lta bur blta'o //
translated: In this regard, the mirror should be seen as like the coming together of the parents.

original: ji ltar lus mi snang na gzugs brnyan mi snang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar lus mi snang na gzugs brnyan mi snang ste /
translated: Just as a reflection does not appear when a body is not present,

original: dper na / me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin yod pa spangs nas /
analyzed: dper na / me long gi dkyil 'khor la gzugs brnyan gyi rang bzhin yod pa spangs nas /
translated: just as a reflection appears in a mirror when a form is present,

original: yang chu'i nang du gzugs brnyan 'byung bar byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang lus yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: yang chu'i nang du gzugs brnyan 'byung bar byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang lus yongs su btang ste /
translated: in the same way, when this element of consciousness leaves the body,

original: lus kyi rang bzhin 'phangs nas phung po gzhan thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin 'phangs nas phung po gzhan thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: having cast off the body’s nature, it takes up another body.

original: dper na / sa bon gyi khams chung ngu zin kyang shing n+ya gro ta dang / au dum wa ra la sogs pa'i shing gi phung po chen po bskyed nas /
analyzed: dper na / sa bon gyi khams chung ngu zin kyang shing n+ya gro ta dang / au dum wa ra la sogs pa'i shing gi phung po chen po bskyed nas /
translated: For example, even though the element of a seed is small, it produces a great mass of wood, such as a banyan tree, an udumbara tree, and so on.

original: yang shing de yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: yang shing de yongs su btang ste /
translated: Then, having cast off that tree,

original: shing gzhan 'dzin la sa bon gyi khams yongs su btang ba na /🔽dus bzlog par 'gyur bas shing de'i khams kyi bcud med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing gzhan 'dzin la sa bon gyi khams yongs su btang ba na / dus bzlog par 'gyur bas shing de'i khams kyi bcud med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the seed element is relinquished in the apprehension of another tree,🔽the time is reversed and the tree’s nutritive essence is lost.

original: khams kyi bcud rnams med par gyur pas shing de yongs su rnyings shing yongs su skam par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: khams kyi bcud rnams med par gyur pas shing de yongs su rnyings shing yongs su skam par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: When the nutritive essence is lost, the tree becomes old and dry.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams phra zhing mi gsal ba 'dis kyang lus rnams @152b bskyed nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams phra zhing mi gsal ba 'dis kyang lus rnams @152b bskyed nas /
translated: In the same way, this subtle and unclear consciousness element generates bodies.

original: yang yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: yang yongs su btang ste /
translated: Then, it is relinquished

original: lus gzhan dag sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: lus gzhan dag sgrub par byed do //
translated: and creates other bodies.

original: dper na / nas dang / til dang / gro dang / mon sran gre'u dang / mon sran sde'u la sogs pa'i sa bon cung zad gang na yod pa der cung zad sems pa lta bur gnas par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / nas dang / til dang / gro dang / mon sran gre'u dang / mon sran sde'u la sogs pa'i sa bon cung zad gang na yod pa der cung zad sems pa lta bur gnas par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, wherever there is a small seed of barley, sesame, wheat, mung bean, or kidney bean, there is a small amount of consciousness that abides.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang sems can gyi ris gang dang gang du 'pho ba de dang der sems pa yongs su bzung zhing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang sems can gyi ris gang dang gang du 'pho ba de dang der sems pa yongs su bzung zhing /
translated: In the same way, this consciousness element is held in the mind when it is transferred to any class of sentient beings.

original: 'tsho ba chung ngu dang / bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa rjes su bzung nas /
analyzed: 'tsho ba chung ngu dang / bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa rjes su bzung nas /
translated: He takes up a small amount of life, merit, and demerit.

original: 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'pho'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'pho'o //
translated: He passes from this world to the next world.🔽For example, a bee, craving taste, remains for a long time in a flower,

original: dper na / bung ba ro la sred pas yun ring du me tog la gnas te; longs spyod nas me tog yongs su btang ste me tog gzhan du 'pho la /
analyzed: dper na / bung ba ro la sred pas yun ring du me tog la gnas te; longs spyod nas me tog yongs su btang ste me tog gzhan du 'pho la /
translated: and after enjoying it, leaves the flower and moves to another flower.

original: bung ba de yang me tog dri mi zhim pa longs spyad nas /
analyzed: bung ba de yang me tog dri mi zhim pa longs spyad nas /
translated: And that bee, after enjoying a foul-smelling flower,

original: dri zhim par 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: dri zhim par 'gro bar byed do //
translated: goes to a fragrant one.

original: me tog gang dang gang la 'byar ba de dang de la chags shing ro yang myong bar byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang lha rnams kyi nang du lha'i lus blangs te dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu longs spyad nas /
analyzed: me tog gang dang gang la 'byar ba de dang de la chags shing ro yang myong bar byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang lha rnams kyi nang du lha'i lus blangs te dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu longs spyad nas /
translated: Just as it sticks to a flower and enjoys its taste, in the same way, this consciousness element takes up a divine body among the gods and enjoys the roots of virtue.

original: phyir yang sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kyi nang du lus blangs te /
analyzed: phyir yang sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kyi nang du lus blangs te /
translated: And again, it takes up a body among hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: des mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su myong nas yang phung po lnga po gzhan dag len to //
analyzed: des mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su myong nas yang phung po lnga po gzhan dag len to //
translated: Having experienced the roots of non-virtue, they again take up the five aggregates.

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one view the consciousness element?

original: dper na / gur gum gyi sa bon nam /
analyzed: dper na / gur gum gyi sa bon nam /
translated: For example, saffron seeds

original: leb rgan rtsi'i sa bon rnams rang bzhin gyis dkar la de dag gi khong na myu gu yang mi snang /
analyzed: leb rgan rtsi'i sa bon rnams rang bzhin gyis dkar la de dag gi khong na myu gu yang mi snang /
translated: or seeds of the white lotus are naturally white, and in them no sprout is seen,

original: me tog kyang mi snang /
analyzed: me tog kyang mi snang /
translated: no flower is seen,

original: kha dog kyang mi snang yang sa bon @153a *//
analyzed: kha dog kyang mi snang yang sa bon @153a *//
translated: and no color is seen.

original: de sa'i khams la btab na /
analyzed: de sa'i khams la btab na /
translated: But when those seeds are planted in the earth

original: chu'i khams kyis yongs su brlan nas myu gu mngon par 'grub bar byed de /
analyzed: chu'i khams kyis yongs su brlan nas myu gu mngon par 'grub bar byed de /
translated: and moistened by the water element, they produce a sprout.

original: myu gu mngon par grub nas me tog dmar po'am /
analyzed: myu gu mngon par grub nas me tog dmar po'am /
translated: When the sprout has been produced, a red,

original: dkar po'am / sngon po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dkar po'am / sngon po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: white, or blue flower appears.

original: 'on kyang kha dog de yang sa bon gyi khong na mi gnas la /
analyzed: 'on kyang kha dog de yang sa bon gyi khong na mi gnas la /
translated: But that color does not exist in the seed.

original: sa bon med na yang kha dog dang myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang lus yongs su btang nas /
analyzed: sa bon med na yang kha dog dang myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang lus yongs su btang nas /
translated: In the same way, this consciousness element, having given up the body,

original: mi'i sha tshugs can yin la /
analyzed: mi'i sha tshugs can yin la /
translated: is in the form of a human being.

original: sha snag gu'i dbang po 'byung ba'i skye mched dang ldan pa ma yin te /

analyzed: lus de yang rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis bsdus pa yin te; dper na /

analyzed: la la ni ro tsha bar 'gyur /
