translated: Having taken up the element of mental objects associated with memory, which is either virtuous or nonvirtuous, one goes to the next world.

original: dper na / dge ba chen po zhes bya'i sman mar de ni sman ro tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva'i ro dang / bska ba'i ro'i mthu dang / rnam par smin pa du ma blangs nas lus kyi nang du 'gro'o //
analyzed: dper na / dge ba chen po zhes bya'i sman mar de ni sman ro tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva'i ro dang / bska ba'i ro'i mthu dang / rnam par smin pa du ma blangs nas lus kyi nang du 'gro'o //
translated: For example, it is like the medicinal butter called “great virtue.” It goes inside the body, having taken up the power and the various results of the tastes of hot, sour, salty, and astringent.

original: dge ba'i sman mar gyi ro'i mthu dang / rnam par smin ba de nang du song bas /
analyzed: dge ba'i sman mar gyi ro'i mthu dang / rnam par smin ba de nang du song bas /
translated: And the power and the results of the tastes of that virtuous medicinal butter go inside.

original: lus la kha dog dang / dri dang / ro skyed par byed cing; de mar gyi khams yongs su btang nas /
analyzed: lus la kha dog dang / dri dang / ro skyed par byed cing; de mar gyi khams yongs su btang nas /
translated: It produces color, smell, taste, and texture in the body, and when the element of oil is given up,

original: lus la 'pho ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang lus yongs su btang nas /
analyzed: lus la 'pho ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang lus yongs su btang nas /
translated: the body is transformed. In the same way, when this element of consciousness gives up the body,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su blangs shing chos kyi khams yongs su blangs nas rnam par shes pa 'pho bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su blangs shing chos kyi khams yongs su blangs nas rnam par shes pa 'pho bar 'gyur te /
translated: it takes up virtue and nonvirtue, and when it takes up the element of Dharma, consciousness is transformed.

original: mar gyi khams gang yin pa de ni lus lta bu'o //
analyzed: mar gyi khams gang yin pa de ni lus lta bu'o //
translated: The element of oil is like the body.

original: sman rnams phrad pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po rnams phrad pa lta @156a *//
analyzed: sman rnams phrad pa gang yin pa de ni dbang po rnams phrad pa lta @156a *//
translated: The coming together of the medicines is like the coming together of the faculties.

original: bu'o // sman rnams kyi kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bu'o // sman rnams kyi kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The color, smell, taste, and texture of the medicines is like consciousness.

original: 'pho ba gang yin pa de ni shi 'phos pa'i rnam par shes pa 'pho ba lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba gang yin pa de ni shi 'phos pa'i rnam par shes pa 'pho ba lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: The transformation should be seen as like the transformation of consciousness at death.

original: mi'i kha dog rgyas pa dang / mdog bzang zhing bde bar smin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba lta bur bstan to //
analyzed: mi'i kha dog rgyas pa dang / mdog bzang zhing bde bar smin pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba lta bur bstan to //
translated: The ripening of a good complexion, a good color, and happiness is taught as being like a virtue.

original: dge ba chen po'i sman mar des mdog ngan cing skya bor 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mi dge ba lta bur bstan to //
analyzed: dge ba chen po'i sman mar des mdog ngan cing skya bor 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni mi dge ba lta bur bstan to //
translated: The ripening of a bad complexion, a bad color, and unhappiness is taught as being like a non-virtue.

original: dge ba chen po'i sman mar rin po che ji lta ba de bzhin du ni rnam par shes pa'i khams blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba chen po'i sman mar rin po che ji lta ba de bzhin du ni rnam par shes pa'i khams blta bar bya'o //
translated: The consciousness element should be seen as being like the precious medicine.

original: ji ltar dge ba chen po'i sman mar gyis sman rnams kyi kha dog 'jug par byed cing /
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba chen po'i sman mar gyis sman rnams kyi kha dog 'jug par byed cing /
translated: Just as the precious medicine causes the colors of the medicines to be absorbed,

original: ro dang / dri 'jug par byed kyang /
analyzed: ro dang / dri 'jug par byed kyang /
translated: and causes their tastes and smells to be absorbed,🔽and just as that medicine has no arms or legs or eyes,

original: mar de la rkang lag dang mig med pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang yongs su btang zhing khams rnams bor nas /
analyzed: mar de la rkang lag dang mig med pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang yongs su btang zhing khams rnams bor nas /
translated: in the same way, this consciousness element, having abandoned and cast off the elements,

original: chos kyi khams yongs su len cing /
analyzed: chos kyi khams yongs su len cing /
translated: takes up the element of mental objects,

original: tshor ba yongs su len te /
analyzed: tshor ba yongs su len te /
translated: and takes up feelings,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su len to //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su len to //
translated: and takes up virtue and non-virtue.

original: zla ba 'byor pa; mi shi 'phos pa des kyang lha'i dran pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba 'byor pa; mi shi 'phos pa des kyang lha'i dran pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The deceased will also attain the recollection of the gods.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa drug gi lha rnams mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa drug gi lha rnams mthong ngo //
translated: They will see the gods of the six classes of the desire realm.

original: sems can dmyal ba bcu drug kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba bcu drug kyang mthong ngo //
translated: They will also see the sixteen hells.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus rkang lag mnyam pa yang mthong ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus rkang lag mnyam pa yang mthong ste /
translated: They will see their own body with its even limbs and hands.

original: de 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag gi khog pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag gi khog pa yin no //
translated: They will think, ‘This is my body.’

original: snyam du yang shes so //
analyzed: snyam du yang shes so //
translated: They will also know that.

original: de 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe'i dran pas lha'i ltas khang pa brtsegs pa rnam par bkra @156b zhing; shing gal pa dang / 'khri shing dang / ldum bu sna tshogs kyis kun nas bskor ba gser btso ma gsar pa'i mdog ltar spa ba /
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe'i dran pas lha'i ltas khang pa brtsegs pa rnam par bkra @156b zhing; shing gal pa dang / 'khri shing dang / ldum bu sna tshogs kyis kun nas bskor ba gser btso ma gsar pa'i mdog ltar spa ba /
translated: When they die, they will remember the signs of the gods. They will see a multistoried palace that is colorful, surrounded by various trees, vines, and bushes, and as radiant as the color of newly refined gold.

original: spras pa / rnam par dbye ba byas pa dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: spras pa / rnam par dbye ba byas pa dag mthong ngo //
translated: It will be adorned and divided into sections.

original: de ltas de mthong nas /
analyzed: de ltas de mthong nas /
translated: When they see it,

original: mchog tu dga' ba skyes te /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba skyes te /
translated: they will feel supreme joy.

original: de dga' ba skyes pa des bde ba'i rnam par smin pa'i 'chi ba'i dus kyi chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dga' ba skyes pa des bde ba'i rnam par smin pa'i 'chi ba'i dus kyi chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The joy that arises from this will be the ripening of happiness at the time of death.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa de ni rta la zhon pa dang 'dra bar lta ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa de ni rta la zhon pa dang 'dra bar lta ste /
translated: This consciousness is like a rider on a horse.

original: dper na / g-yul ngor chas pa na /
analyzed: dper na / g-yul ngor chas pa na /
translated: For example, when a soldier is ready for battle,

original: dmag mi'i nang na mi ci la ma reg par chas pa sga las bzung ste /
analyzed: dmag mi'i nang na mi ci la ma reg par chas pa sga las bzung ste /
translated: he holds the reins of his horse and rides it quickly and without touching any other soldier.

original: myur ba myur bar zhon par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang dge ba la dmigs pa dang 'brel cing /
analyzed: myur ba myur bar zhon par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang dge ba la dmigs pa dang 'brel cing /
translated: In the same way, this element of consciousness is connected to the observation of virtue,

original: dbugs rgyu ba rgod pas chos kyi khams yongs su blangs shing skye mched 'gags te /🔽lus bor nas lha'i gnas 'og min man chad tshangs pa'i bar du yongs su len par 'gyur ro ////
analyzed: dbugs rgyu ba rgod pas chos kyi khams yongs su blangs shing skye mched 'gags te / lus bor nas lha'i gnas 'og min man chad tshangs pa'i bar du yongs su len par 'gyur ro ////
translated: and it takes up the element of phenomena with the speed of the breath.

original: bam po gnyis pa ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: When the sense bases cease, the body is cast off and it takes up a divine abode, from Akaniṣṭha down to Brahmā.

original: de nas sman chen gyis /
analyzed: de nas sman chen gyis /
translated: Then Mahāmaudgalyāyana

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas /
translated: bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed One🔽and said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rnam par shes pa lus las 'pho ba de'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig lags /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lus las 'pho ba de'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhig lags /
translated: What is the nature of consciousness when it departs from the body?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied,

original: sman chen / da ltar khyod kyis nga la ji skad bskul ba de ni de bzhin te; legs so //
analyzed: sman chen / da ltar khyod kyis nga la ji skad bskul ba de ni de bzhin te; legs so //
translated: “Mahāmaudgalyāyana, what you have requested of me is just so.

original: legs so // dri ba 'di ni mchog tu zab bo //
analyzed: legs so // dri ba 'di ni mchog tu zab bo //
translated: Excellent, excellent! This question is supremely profound.

original: dri ba 'dri ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan par bya ba yin te /🔽rnam par shes pa de ston pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs @157a *//
analyzed: dri ba 'dri ni de bzhin gshegs pas bstan par bya ba yin te / rnam par shes pa de ston pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs @157a *//
translated: The question should be taught by the Tathāgata.

original: par gzhan med do //
analyzed: par gzhan med do //
translated: The teaching of consciousness is not for anyone other than the Tathāgata.🔽”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la bzang skyong gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la bzang skyong gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Bhadrapāla said to the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu sman chen ni zab mo'i zhu ba zhu ba la mkhas pa lags te /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu sman chen ni zab mo'i zhu ba zhu ba la mkhas pa lags te /
translated: Prince Mahāmaudgalyāyana is skilled in asking profound questions.

original: blo zhib cing mdzangs la mkhas pa lags so //
analyzed: blo zhib cing mdzangs la mkhas pa lags so //
translated: He is wise, intelligent, and learned.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: bzang skyong / de bzhin te /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de bzhin te /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, that is so.

original: rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu sman chen 'di ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par gzigs la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu sman chen 'di ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par gzigs la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa yin no //
translated: This young prince Mahāmaudgalyāyana has planted roots of merit under the Bhagavān Vipaśyin.

original: bzang skyong / rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu sman chen 'di ni tshe rabs lnga brgya'i bar du gzhan mu stegs can du gyur nas de 'di snyam du rtog ste /
analyzed: bzang skyong / rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu sman chen 'di ni tshe rabs lnga brgya'i bar du gzhan mu stegs can du gyur nas de 'di snyam du rtog ste /
translated: Bhadrapāla, this young prince Mahāmaudgalyāyana, for five hundred lifetimes, has been a non-Buddhist. He thinks like this:

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ci yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ci yin /
translated: ‘What is this element of consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di su'i yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di su'i yin /
translated: Whose is this element of consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ci lta bu zhig yin snyam mo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ci lta bu zhig yin snyam mo //
translated: What is this element of consciousness like?’

original: bzang skyong / 'on kyang rnam shes pa'i 'gro ba dang 'ong ba khong du ma chud de /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'on kyang rnam shes pa'i 'gro ba dang 'ong ba khong du ma chud de /
translated: Bhadrapāla, however, he has not understood the coming and going of consciousness.

original: ngas 'di'i the tshom bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngas 'di'i the tshom bsal bar bya'o //
translated: I will dispel his doubts.”

original: de nas tshong dpon bzang skyong gis sman chen la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon bzang skyong gis sman chen la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the merchant Bhadrapāla said to Mahāmaudgalyāyana,

original: sman chen / legs so //
analyzed: sman chen / legs so //
translated: “Mahāmaudgalyāyana, excellent!

original: legs so; ;khyod ni shes rab rgya che zhing yangs la chos zab mo zhu ba la mkhas so //
analyzed: legs so; ;khyod ni shes rab rgya che zhing yangs la chos zab mo zhu ba la mkhas so //
translated: Excellent! You have vast and extensive wisdom and are skilled in asking about the profound Dharma.”

original: sman chen / bcom ldan 'das ye shes la 'jug pa blo dag pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa la skul cig /
analyzed: sman chen / bcom ldan 'das ye shes la 'jug pa blo dag pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa la skul cig /
translated: Great Doctor, exhort the Bhagavat to teach the root of the purification of the mind that enters into wisdom.

original: zla ba 'byor pa; 'di ni byis pa ste yul la sred pas /
analyzed: zla ba 'byor pa; 'di ni byis pa ste yul la sred pas /
translated: Candrabhadra,  'This is a child, greedy for objects.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa la lan 'ga' yang ma bskul /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa la lan 'ga' yang ma bskul /
translated: He has never before exhorted the Bhagavat Tathāgata.

original: bskul ba ma byas so //
analyzed: bskul ba ma byas so //
translated: He has not made an exhortation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ni @157b rnyed par dka' la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ni @157b rnyed par dka' la /
translated: The appearance of the Tathāgata is difficult to find.

original: dam pa'i chos dang phrad pa yang shin tu rnyed par dka'i /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos dang phrad pa yang shin tu rnyed par dka'i /
translated: It is also very difficult to find the encounter with the true Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zab pa zab pa'i gnas rnams bcom ldan 'das la skul cig /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zab pa zab pa'i gnas rnams bcom ldan 'das la skul cig /
translated: Exhort the Bhagavat about the profound, profound points of the Bhagavat.'

original: de nas sman chen gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal ston ka'i dus kyi me tog padma'i tshal ltar rgyas pa mthong ngo //🔽mthong nas kyang sman chen dad pa skyes te /🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas sman chen gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal ston ka'i dus kyi me tog padma'i tshal ltar rgyas pa mthong ngo // mthong nas kyang sman chen dad pa skyes te / bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mahāmaudgalyāyana saw the Bhagavat's face, which was like a blooming autumn lotus flower.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Having seen it, Mahāmaudgalyāyana gave rise to faith and said to the Bhagavat, Bhagavat,🔽I desire the Dharma. Sugata, please teach me.

original: bdag ni chos 'tshal ba lags na bde bar gshegs pas bdag la bstan du gsol //
analyzed: bdag ni chos 'tshal ba lags na bde bar gshegs pas bdag la bstan du gsol //
translated: I am seeking the Dharma, so may the Sugata teach me.”🔽

original: bskal pa'i mthar ma thug par yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gshegs pa zhig tu gyur na /
analyzed: bskal pa'i mthar ma thug par yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gshegs pa zhig tu gyur na /
translated: If he were to pass into parinirvāṇa before the end of the eon,

original: de'i slad na sems can 'di dag gis las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ma 'tshal te /
analyzed: de'i slad na sems can 'di dag gis las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ma 'tshal te /
translated: then these sentient beings would not understand the ripening of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions,

original: 'khor ba na yongs su 'khyam par 'gyur du mchi'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba na yongs su 'khyam par 'gyur du mchi'o //
translated: and they would wander in saṃsāra.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sman chen / ngas tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi don gyi phyir yang brag gi rtse mo nas rang gi lus bor te /
analyzed: sman chen / ngas tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyi don gyi phyir yang brag gi rtse mo nas rang gi lus bor te /
translated: “Mahāmaudgalyāyana, for the sake of the meaning of half a verse I even threw myself from the peak of a cliff

original: dka' ba rnam pa brgya stong du ma nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: dka' ba rnam pa brgya stong du ma nyams su myong ngo //
translated: and experienced many hundreds of thousands of hardships.

original: sman chen khyed ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig dang / ngas khyod la lan gdab bo //
analyzed: sman chen khyed ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig dang / ngas khyod la lan gdab bo //
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, ask whatever you wish. I will answer your questions.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Blessed One had said this,

original: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana asked the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rnam par shes pa 'di'i rang bzhin ci lags /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di'i rang bzhin ci lags /
translated: what is the nature of this consciousness?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Mahāmaudgalyāyana,

original: sman chen / sgyu ma mkhan gyi mi'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / mi'i grib ma chu'i nang du 'byung ba gsal ba ma yin @158a *//
analyzed: sman chen / sgyu ma mkhan gyi mi'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / mi'i grib ma chu'i nang du 'byung ba gsal ba ma yin @158a *//
translated: the nature of a human reflection in water, which is not clear and is not unclear,🔽the nature of the eye and space,

original: zhing; mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / mig dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / sred pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhing; mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / mig dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / sred pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa bzhin no //
translated: and the nature of craving.”

original: sman chen gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: sman chen gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana said:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: sred pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: sred pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bu lags /
translated: what is the nature of craving?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽“When one sees a beloved person, the eye faculty moves.

original: snying du sdug pa'i mi mthong ba na mig gi dbang po 'pho ba dang; ji ltar mis me long la rang gi bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan mthong la /
analyzed: snying du sdug pa'i mi mthong ba na mig gi dbang po 'pho ba dang; ji ltar mis me long la rang gi bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan mthong la /
translated: Just as when a person sees the reflection of their own face in a mirror,

original: me long gud du phyung na rang gi bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan mi mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: me long gud du phyung na rang gi bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan mi mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: but when the mirror is removed, they no longer see the reflection of their own face,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di 'pho na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di 'pho na /
translated: in the same way, when this element of consciousness moves,

original: rang gi bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'i khams des mthong ngo //
analyzed: rang gi bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa rnam par shes pa'i khams des mthong ngo //
translated: This element of consciousness sees one’s own merit and demerit.

original: dper na / mi dmus long gis nyi ma 'char ba'am /🔽nyi ma gung na 'dug pa yang mi mthong la /
analyzed: dper na / mi dmus long gis nyi ma 'char ba'am / nyi ma gung na 'dug pa yang mi mthong la /
translated: For example, a man born blind cannot see the sun rising or🔽setting,

original: mtshan mo yang zla ba 'char ba dang / nub pa mi mthong ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang lus la mi snang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan mo yang zla ba 'char ba dang / nub pa mi mthong ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang lus la mi snang ngo //
translated: nor can he see the moon rising or setting at night. In the same way, this element of consciousness does not appear in the body.

original: sman chen / 'on kyang lus la sred pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / rab tu shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i khams yin te /
analyzed: sman chen / 'on kyang lus la sred pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / rab tu shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'i khams yin te /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, however, that craving, feeling, perception, and cognition that are in the body are the element of consciousness.

original: de yang lus 'di'i khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / phung po rnams phrad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang lus 'di'i khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / phung po rnams phrad par byed pa yin no //
translated: And that causes the elements, sense bases, and aggregates of this body to come together.

original: de la gzugs can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs can gyi dngos po gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, whatever is a material thing is as follows:

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / ro dang / sgra rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / ro dang / sgra rnams so //
translated: the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and sound.

original: tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba dang / @158b yid rnams ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / bde ba dang / @158b yid rnams ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: pain, pleasure, and the mind are immaterial things.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa'i khams yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa'i khams yin no //
translated: This is the element of consciousness.

original: sman chen / ji ltar mi'i lce'i thor tos ro kha ba dang / tsha ba dang / skyur ba dang / mngar ba dang / lan tshva'i ro dang / bska ba tshor te /
analyzed: sman chen / ji ltar mi'i lce'i thor tos ro kha ba dang / tsha ba dang / skyur ba dang / mngar ba dang / lan tshva'i ro dang / bska ba tshor te /
translated: Mahabhaisajya, just as the human tongue perceives the tastes of bitter, sour, sweet, salty, and astringent,

original: de'i lce de yang gzugs can yin la /
analyzed: de'i lce de yang gzugs can yin la /
translated: the tongue is a material thing.

original: ro'i dngos po yang gzugs can yin no //
analyzed: ro'i dngos po yang gzugs can yin no //
translated: The substance of taste is also material.

original: de bzhin du lus 'di la yang rus pa dang / rkang dang / sha dang / khrag ni gzugs can yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus 'di la yang rus pa dang / rkang dang / sha dang / khrag ni gzugs can yin la /
translated: In the same way, in this body, the bones, marrow, flesh, and blood are material.

original: tshor ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs can ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs can ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is feeling is immaterial.

original: gang gis rnam par smin pa dang / bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa myong ba de ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis rnam par smin pa dang / bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa myong ba de ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: That which experiences the ripening of merit and demerit is consciousness.

original: de nas bzang skyong gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas /
analyzed: de nas bzang skyong gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas /
translated: Then Bhadrapāla touched the feet of the Blessed One and said:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He addressed the Lord as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma lags pa myong ba de gang lags /
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma lags pa myong ba de gang lags /
translated: what is the experience of merit and demerit?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: bzang skyong / de'i phyir nyon cig /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de'i phyir nyon cig /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, listen!

original: bden pa ma mthong bar ni /
analyzed: bden pa ma mthong bar ni /
translated: Without seeing the truth,

original: rnam par shes pa 'di mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di mi mthong ste /
translated: this consciousness is not seen.

original: de ni lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin du mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin du mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not seen as if placed in the palm of the hand.

original: de ni mig la yang mi gnas te mig las kyang skye ba mthong bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni mig la yang mi gnas te mig las kyang skye ba mthong bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not dwell in the eye, nor is it seen arising from the eye.

original: bzang skyong / de bzhin gshegs pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gis rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ci ltar gzigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de bzhin gshegs pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gis rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ci ltar gzigs pa de bzhin du /
translated: Bhadrapāla, just as the Tathāgatas equal to the sands of the Ganges have seen this consciousness element,

original: ngas kyang gzugs can ma yin par thugs su chud de /
analyzed: ngas kyang gzugs can ma yin par thugs su chud de /
translated: in the same way I have also realized it as formless.

original: 'on kyang byis pa rnams kyis mi shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa rnams kyis mi shes pa'i phyir /
translated: However, because it is not known by the childish,

original: rnam par shes pa'i @159a *//
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i @159a *//
translated: this consciousness element

original: khams 'di dpes bstan to //
analyzed: khams 'di dpes bstan to //
translated: is taught through an example.

original: bzang skyong / 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig ste /🔽dper na / mi la la skem byed dam /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di ni rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig ste / dper na / mi la la skem byed dam /
translated: Bhadrapāla, this element of consciousness knows merit and demerit just as they are.

original: brjed byed dam /🔽dri za'i gdon nam /
analyzed: brjed byed dam / dri za'i gdon nam /
translated: For example, if someone is afflicted by a wasting disease,🔽or by epilepsy,🔽or by a gandharva demon,

original: lha'i gdon gyis zin par gyur na /
analyzed: lha'i gdon gyis zin par gyur na /
translated: or by a divine demon,

original: bzang skyong / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽ci mi de'i khong na 'dug pa'i skem byed dam /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di ji snyam du sems / ci mi de'i khong na 'dug pa'i skem byed dam /
translated: Bhadrapāla, what do you think of this?🔽Is the wasting disease,

original: dri za'am / lha de snang ngam /
analyzed: dri za'am / lha de snang ngam /
translated: or the gandharva, or the god that is inside that person visible?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma lags so //🔽mi de'i nang ngam /
analyzed: de ni ma lags so // mi de'i nang ngam /
translated: it is not.🔽That person does not have a wasting disease,

original: slad rol na yang gdon mi gda' ste /
analyzed: slad rol na yang gdon mi gda' ste /
translated: or a gandharva, or a god either inside or outside.🔽Those demons are formless.”

original: gdon de dag ni gzugs ma mchis pa lags so //🔽bzang skyong / dper na /
analyzed: gdon de dag ni gzugs ma mchis pa lags so // bzang skyong / dper na /
translated: Bhadrapāla,

original: lha'i gdon chen pos me tog shin tu dri zhim pa dang / spos dang / bdug pa dang / me tog phreng byin pa len pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams bsod nams dang ldan pas kyang lus blangs nas /
analyzed: lha'i gdon chen pos me tog shin tu dri zhim pa dang / spos dang / bdug pa dang / me tog phreng byin pa len pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams bsod nams dang ldan pas kyang lus blangs nas /
translated: just as a great divine demon gives fragrant flowers, incense, perfume, and garlands to take, in the same way, the element of consciousness endowed with merit takes on a body.

original: rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug gam /
analyzed: rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug gam /
translated: or the power of kingship,

original: tshong dpon nyid dam /
analyzed: tshong dpon nyid dam /
translated: or the status of a guild master,

original: lha nyid byed du 'jug ste /
analyzed: lha nyid byed du 'jug ste /
translated: or the status of a god.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni bsod nams myong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni bsod nams myong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this consciousness element is the experience of merit.

original: ji ltar lha'i gdon de lha'i me tog phreng ba byin pas rangs par 'gyur zhing mi de'i lus kyang tshim par 'gyur pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug nyid la dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar lha'i gdon de lha'i me tog phreng ba byin pas rangs par 'gyur zhing mi de'i lus kyang tshim par 'gyur pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug nyid la dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Just as that divine spirit is pleased by the offering of a divine flower garland and the body of that person is satisfied, in the same way, this consciousness element is pleased by the power of kingship and

original: lus de yang tshim par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus de yang tshim par 'gyur te /
translated: that body is satisfied.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa 'di ni bsod nams myong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa 'di ni bsod nams myong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this consciousness is the experience of merit.🔽Bhadrapāla,

original: bzang skyong / @159b dper na /
analyzed: bzang skyong / @159b dper na /
translated: for example,

original: srul po'i gdon mi sdug cing gzugs mi snang ba mi'i lus la gnas te /
analyzed: srul po'i gdon mi sdug cing gzugs mi snang ba mi'i lus la gnas te /
translated: an ugly and inauspicious spirit of a beggar dwells in the human body.

original: mi gtsang ba dang / rul pa dang / ljan ljin dang / gtor khung nas 'bab pa dang / gtor ma 'dod cing de yang gtor ma des dga' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba dang / rul pa dang / ljan ljin dang / gtor khung nas 'bab pa dang / gtor ma 'dod cing de yang gtor ma des dga' bar 'gyur la /
translated: It desires filth, rot, garbage, what flows from the mouth, and offerings, and is pleased by those offerings.

original: mi de yang gdon gyi dbang gis dri nga zhing mi gtsang ba las byung ba'i kha zas btsog pa dag la chags shing dga' bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i las kyis skye gnas🔽ngan par bskyed de dbul po'am /🔽yi dvags ngan pa'am /
analyzed: mi de yang gdon gyi dbang gis dri nga zhing mi gtsang ba las byung ba'i kha zas btsog pa dag la chags shing dga' bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i las kyis skye gnas ngan par bskyed de dbul po'am / yi dvags ngan pa'am /
translated: In the same way, this element of consciousness, due to unmeritorious actions, is born in a bad place of rebirth🔽and becomes attached to and delights in the food of the poor,🔽the food of the hungry ghosts,

original: ljan ljin za ba dag la chags shing dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ljan ljin za ba dag la chags shing dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: or the food of the filthy.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni bsod nams ma yin pa myong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni bsod nams ma yin pa myong ba yang yin no //
translated: In this way, this element of consciousness is also the experience of demerit.

original: dper na / lha'i gdon chen po gzugs med pa de lha'i longs spyod len pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / lha'i gdon chen po gzugs med pa de lha'i longs spyod len pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, that formless great demon of the gods takes the enjoyments of the gods.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams gzugs can ma yin pa 'di yang bsod nams gzugs can ma yin pas yongs su bzung nas lha'i lus rnams skyed par byed do; ;dper na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams gzugs can ma yin pa 'di yang bsod nams gzugs can ma yin pas yongs su bzung nas lha'i lus rnams skyed par byed do; ;dper na /
translated: In the same way, this formless element of consciousness, having been taken up by the formless merit, produces the bodies of the gods.🔽For example,

original: srul po'i gdon gzugs med pa mi la gnas shing phyi sa dang / ljan ljin za bar byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i las rnams kyis skye gnas ngan par skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srul po'i gdon gzugs med pa mi la gnas shing phyi sa dang / ljan ljin za bar byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di yang bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i las rnams kyis skye gnas ngan par skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the ghost of a miser, which is formless and dwells in a human being, eats feces and urine, so too this consciousness element goes to an unfortunate rebirth due to unmeritorious actions.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro bar yang lta'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro bar yang lta'o //
translated: Thus, this consciousness element is seen to go to an unfortunate rebirth.

original: bzang skyong / de bas @160a *//
analyzed: bzang skyong / de bas @160a *//
translated: Bhadrapāla,

original: na khyod kyis gdon gang yin pa de ni gzugs med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: na khyod kyis gdon gang yin pa de ni gzugs med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams lta bur blta'o //
translated: therefore you should view the ghost as being like the consciousness element, because it is formless.

original: gdon gyi longs spyod bzang po dang / ngan pa gang yin pa de dag ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba lta bur lta'o //
analyzed: gdon gyi longs spyod bzang po dang / ngan pa gang yin pa de dag ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba lta bur lta'o //
translated: You should view the good and bad enjoyments of the ghost as being like virtue and nonvirtue.

original: mi gang yin pa de ni lus lta bur lta'o //
analyzed: mi gang yin pa de ni lus lta bur lta'o //
translated: You should view the human being as being like the body.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mahāmaudgalyāyana said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: 'di ni len pa'i rgyu ji ltar lta bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ni len pa'i rgyu ji ltar lta bar bgyi /
translated: How should one understand the causes of appropriation?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: 'di ni phan tshun gyi rkyen gyis 'dod pa len par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshun gyi rkyen gyis 'dod pa len par byed de /
translated: “It is through mutual conditions that desire is appropriated.

original: dper na / gtsub stan las kyang brten /
analyzed: dper na / gtsub stan las kyang brten /
translated: For example, fire is produced in dependence on a fire-drill stick,

original: gtsub shing las kyang brten /
analyzed: gtsub shing las kyang brten /
translated: in dependence on a lower fire-drill stick,

original: de skyed pa mi'i rtsol ba las kyang brten te /
analyzed: de skyed pa mi'i rtsol ba las kyang brten te /
translated: and in dependence on the effort of a person who generates it.

original: me 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin du lus 'di len pa'i rgyu skyes pa dang / bud med kyi rkyen gyis sgra dang / reg pa dang / ro dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me 'grub par 'gyur ba de bzhin du lus 'di len pa'i rgyu skyes pa dang / bud med kyi rkyen gyis sgra dang / reg pa dang / ro dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i 'dod pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the causes of appropriating this body are the conditions of a man and a woman, and the desires of sound, touch, taste, form, and so forth are produced.

original: dper na / me tog las 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na / me tog las 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: For example, a fruit is produced from a flower,

original: 'on kyang me tog de la yang 'bras bu mi dmigs la; 'bras bur grub pa la yang me tog mi dmigs pa de bzhin du lus 'di las rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang me tog de la yang 'bras bu mi dmigs la; 'bras bur grub pa la yang me tog mi dmigs pa de bzhin du lus 'di las rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: but the flower is not observed in the fruit, and the fruit is not observed in the flower. In the same way, consciousness arises from this body,

original: 'on kyang lus de la yang rnam par shes pa mi snang la /
analyzed: 'on kyang lus de la yang rnam par shes pa mi snang la /
translated: but consciousness is not seen in the body,🔽and the body is not seen in consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ldog pas kyang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ldog pas kyang /
translated: The cessation of consciousness

original: lus kyi rus pa dang / rkang dang / mer mer po dang / mi gtsang ba rnams rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro //🔽dper na / sa bon de me tog gi kha dog dang / dri dang / @160b ro 'debs pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang /
analyzed: lus kyi rus pa dang / rkang dang / mer mer po dang / mi gtsang ba rnams rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro // dper na / sa bon de me tog gi kha dog dang / dri dang / @160b ro 'debs pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang /
translated: causes the bones, marrow, and impurities of the body to disintegrate.🔽Just as a seed plants the color, smell, and taste of a flower,

original: lus yongs su btang nas dge ba dang / mi dge ba btab cing /
analyzed: lus yongs su btang nas dge ba dang / mi dge ba btab cing /
translated: in the same way, this element of consciousness plants virtue and nonvirtue in the body.🔽After planting feelings, perceptions, and mental formations,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / yid la byed pa yang btab nas; 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / yid la byed pa yang btab nas; 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro'o //
translated: it goes to the next world.

original: dper na / skyes pa dang / bud med gnyis kyi dbang po gnyis phrad nas /
analyzed: dper na / skyes pa dang / bud med gnyis kyi dbang po gnyis phrad nas /
translated: For example, when the organs of a man and a woman come together,

original: dga' bas brlan te /
analyzed: dga' bas brlan te /
translated: they become moist with pleasure.

original: bud med la shin tu dam por 'khyud nas /
analyzed: bud med la shin tu dam por 'khyud nas /
translated: The man embraces the woman tightly

original: nyon mongs pa 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'byin par byed de /
translated: and discharges his affliction.

original: de gnyis kyi nyon mongs pa med par gyur nas yang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi nyon mongs pa med par gyur nas yang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the affliction of both is gone, they separate.

original: de gnyis la 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis la 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The pleasure associated with desire arises in both of them.

original: der nyon mongs pa phyung nas /
analyzed: der nyon mongs pa phyung nas /
translated: Having extracted the afflictions from there,

original: 'dod chags med par gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags med par gyur te /
translated: they become free from attachment.

original: yang gcig la gcig 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis lus dang phrad pa rnyed nas /
analyzed: yang gcig la gcig 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis lus dang phrad pa rnyed nas /
translated: In the same way, this consciousness element, having obtained contact with the body,

original: dga' ba bskyed de chags pa 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: dga' ba bskyed de chags pa 'phel bar byed do //
translated: generates pleasure and increases attachment.

original: dper na / lus kyi rkyen gyis bud med kyi gzugs mthong na /
analyzed: dper na / lus kyi rkyen gyis bud med kyi gzugs mthong na /
translated: For example, due to the condition of the body, when seeing the form of a woman,

original: skyes pa'i 'dod chags bskyed la /
analyzed: skyes pa'i 'dod chags bskyed la /
translated: it generates the desire of a man.

original: yang phrad pa las bral na /
analyzed: yang phrad pa las bral na /
translated: Again, when separated from contact,

original: phyir ldog par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis lus yongs su blangs nas yang bor te gzhan du 'gyur ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir ldog par 'gyur ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis lus yongs su blangs nas yang bor te gzhan du 'gyur ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: it turns back. In the same way, this consciousness element, having taken up the body, does not abandon it and become otherwise.

original: 'di la pha ma phrad pa dang / dri za nye bar gnas pa dang / las la dmigs pa'i dngos po las rnam par shes pas lus 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la pha ma phrad pa dang / dri za nye bar gnas pa dang / las la dmigs pa'i dngos po las rnam par shes pas lus 'grub par byed de /
translated: Here, the body is formed by consciousness from the condition of the parents coming together, the gandharva standing nearby, and the thing that is the focus of karma.

original: las de dag kyang gzugs can ma yin la /
analyzed: las de dag kyang gzugs can ma yin la /
translated: Those karmas are also not physical.

original: skyes pa dang bud med kyi rkyen gyi ngo bo de yang gzugs can ma yin no //🔽len pa'i @161a *//
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med kyi rkyen gyi ngo bo de yang gzugs can ma yin no // len pa'i @161a *//
translated: The nature of the conditions of man and woman is also not physical.🔽The condition of grasping

original: rkyen las 'dod pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: rkyen las 'dod pa 'byung ste /
translated: gives rise to desire.

original: de bas na 'dod pa'i len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa'i len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the grasping of desire.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod pa len pas na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod pa len pas na /
translated: Because of the grasping of desire for form,

original: de'i phyir yang 'dod pa'i len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'dod pa'i len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is also called the grasping of desire.

original: sman chen / gzhan yang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i len pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: sman chen / gzhan yang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i len pa de gang zhe na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, moreover, what is the grasping of the belief in the supremacy of morality and ritual?

original: 'di la tshul khrims ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa log par g-yem pa dang; brdzun du smra ba dang / 'bru'i chang dang / sbyar ba'i chang myos par byed pa bag med pa'i gnas spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la tshul khrims ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa log par g-yem pa dang; brdzun du smra ba dang / 'bru'i chang dang / sbyar ba'i chang myos par byed pa bag med pa'i gnas spong ba'o //
translated: Here, morality is the abandonment of killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and drinking alcohol, which is a cause of heedlessness.

original: de'i mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: de'i mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
translated: The belief in its supremacy

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: is the result of stream entry and the result of once-returner.

original: de'i len pa ni srid pa ste /
analyzed: de'i len pa ni srid pa ste /
translated: Its grasping is existence.

original: lha dang mir skye zhing skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: lha dang mir skye zhing skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa bskyed pa ste /
translated: It produces the taking up of births in the divine and human realms.

original: de ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: It ripens the wholesome that is both contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: phung po rnams kyi sa bon yang rlan par byed do //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi sa bon yang rlan par byed do //
translated: It moistens the seeds of the aggregates.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyang sdud par byed do //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyang sdud par byed do //
translated: It gathers up wholesome and unwholesome actions.

original: rnam par shes pa yang sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang sbyor bar byed do //
translated: It connects consciousness.

original: nyon mongs pa blangs pa rnams kyang sreg par byed de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa blangs pa rnams kyang sreg par byed de /
translated: It burns up the afflictions that have been taken up.

original: de bas na 'di ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i len pa zhes bya'o //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i len pa zhes bya'o // de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: Therefore, this is called the taking up of the holding of morality and asceticism as paramount.🔽The Blessed One said this.

original: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Mahauṣadhi said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rnam par shes pa 'dis ji ltar lha'i nang du lus yongs su len pa lags /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'dis ji ltar lha'i nang du lus yongs su len pa lags /
translated: how does this consciousness take up a body among the gods?

original: sems can dmyal ba rnams su ji ltar len pa @161b lags /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba rnams su ji ltar len pa @161b lags /
translated: How does it take up a body among hell beings?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽“Mahauṣadhi,

original: sman chen / de'i phyir nyon cig /🔽'di la rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis chos kyi khams yongs su blangs nas /
analyzed: sman chen / de'i phyir nyon cig / 'di la rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis chos kyi khams yongs su blangs nas /
translated: “Great Magician, listen!🔽In this regard, having appropriated the element of mental objects,

original: lha'i lta ba bskyed de /
analyzed: lha'i lta ba bskyed de /
translated: this element of consciousness generates the view of the gods.

original: de'i lta ba de yang sha'i mig la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i lta ba de yang sha'i mig la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: And that view is not based on the fleshly eye.

original: de'i lta bas mthong ba gang yin de ni len pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i lta bas mthong ba gang yin de ni len pa zhes bya ste /
translated: What is seen by that view is called ‘appropriation.’

original: de bas na lta ba'i len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lta ba'i len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘appropriation of views.’

original: de'i lha'i lta ba bsod nams la dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa des /
analyzed: de'i lha'i lta ba bsod nams la dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa des /
translated: Through that view of the gods, which is associated with the observation of merit,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du lha'i gnas mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du lha'i gnas mthong ste /
translated: he sees the divine abodes among the gods who live in the desire realm.

original: der lha rnams lha'i rtse bdag gis rtse ba mthong nas /
analyzed: der lha rnams lha'i rtse bdag gis rtse ba mthong nas /
translated: Having seen the gods there playing divine games,

original: de der chags pa skye'o //
analyzed: de der chags pa skye'o //
translated: he develops attachment to them.

original: 'di snyam du yang sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du yang sems te /
translated: He thinks,

original: bdag ni der 'gro'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag ni der 'gro'o snyam mo //
translated: ‘I will go there.’

original: des der chags su rung zhing dran pa dang ldan pa'i srid pa rab tu shes so //
analyzed: des der chags su rung zhing dran pa dang ldan pa'i srid pa rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the existence that is suitable for attachment there and is endowed with mindfulness.

original: dur khrod na 'dug pa'i khog pa de yang des mthong nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: dur khrod na 'dug pa'i khog pa de yang des mthong nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He also saw the corpse in the charnel ground and thought,

original: 'di ni bdag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin te /
translated: “This is my spiritual friend.

original: 'di la bdag lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba yongs su len pa'i bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags so snyam mo //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: 'di la bdag lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba yongs su len pa'i bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags so snyam mo // de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: I accumulated the roots of virtue in his presence that led to my rebirth among the gods.”🔽The Blessed One said this,

original: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and Maheśvara said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rnam par shes pa khog pa de la chags na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa khog pa de la chags na /
translated: if consciousness is attached to that corpse,

original: ci'i slad du mi gnas /
analyzed: ci'i slad du mi gnas /
translated: why does it not remain?

original: khog pa de nyid ci'i slad du mi brten /
analyzed: khog pa de nyid ci'i slad du mi brten /
translated: Why does it not remain in that very corpse?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sman chen / dper na /
analyzed: sman chen / dper na /
translated: “Maheśvara, for example,

original: mi la la'i skra dang / kha spu bregs te /
analyzed: mi la la'i skra dang / kha spu bregs te /
translated: someone shaves their hair and beard.

original: skra dang kha spu de mthong nas /
analyzed: skra dang kha spu de mthong nas /
translated: Seeing that hair and beard,

original: mi de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: mi de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: that person thinks,

original: skra 'di dag ni dri zhim @162a *//🔽zhing gnag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: skra 'di dag ni dri zhim @162a *// zhing gnag pa yin gyi /
translated: ‘This hair is fragrant and black.

original: 'di dag ni phyir yang mgo la bskyed par bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni phyir yang mgo la bskyed par bya'o snyam na /
translated: I will grow it on my head again.’

original: sman chen / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: sman chen / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, what do you think?

original: ci skra de dag phyir skye bar 'gyur ram /🔽gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: ci skra de dag phyir skye bar 'gyur ram / gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Would those hairs grow back?”

original: de ni ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so //
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sman chen / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis khog pa bor nas phyir yang khog pa de nyid la gnas pa 'di ni gnas med do //
analyzed: sman chen / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis khog pa bor nas phyir yang khog pa de nyid la gnas pa 'di ni gnas med do //
translated: “Mahāmaudgalyāyana, in the same way, it is impossible for this element of consciousness to leave the body and then return to that same body.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Blessed One had said this,

original: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis yang 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis yang 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana asked him,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams cha phra zhing mi mngon pa 'dis glang po che'i lus bong chen po ji ltar bsgrub par bgyid cing /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams cha phra zhing mi mngon pa 'dis glang po che'i lus bong chen po ji ltar bsgrub par bgyid cing /
translated: “How does this subtle and imperceptible element of consciousness create the huge body of an elephant?

original: rdo rje ltar sra ba'i khog pa yang ji ltar rtol bar bgyid /
analyzed: rdo rje ltar sra ba'i khog pa yang ji ltar rtol bar bgyid /
translated: How does it break open the body, which is as hard as a diamond?

original: glang po che dgu stong gi stobs dang ldan pa'i mi dang / glang po che'i rgyal po yang ji ltar 'dzin par bgyid /
analyzed: glang po che dgu stong gi stobs dang ldan pa'i mi dang / glang po che'i rgyal po yang ji ltar 'dzin par bgyid /
translated: How does it hold the body of a man who is as strong as nine thousand elephants, and also the body of an elephant king?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Mahāmaudgalyāyana, it is like this.

original: sman chen / dper na /
analyzed: sman chen / dper na /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, it is like this:🔽The wind element is formless and invisible, and it resides in the mountain passes.

original: rlung gi khams gzugs med cing bstan du med pa'i ri phrag na gnas pa de yang ri phrag de nas byung ste /
analyzed: rlung gi khams gzugs med cing bstan du med pa'i ri phrag na gnas pa de yang ri phrag de nas byung ste /
translated: It emerges from those mountain passes

original: ri rab dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa'i ri'i rtse mo snyil bar byed cing /
analyzed: ri rab dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa'i ri'i rtse mo snyil bar byed cing /
translated: and causes the peaks of mountains that are equal to and the same as Mount Sumeru to collapse🔽and disintegrate.

original: 'gyes par byed na sman chen 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'gyes par byed na sman chen 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, what do you think?

original: rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin ni ji lta bu /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin ni ji lta bu /
translated: What is the nature of the wind element?

original: ri de'i rang bzhin ji lta bu /
analyzed: ri de'i rang bzhin ji lta bu /
translated: What is the nature of those mountains?

original: sman chen gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: sman chen gyis gsol pa /
translated: ” Mahāmaudgalyāyana replied,

original: rlung gi khams ni snyi zhing lus ma mchis par lta bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni snyi zhing lus ma mchis par lta bar bgyi'o //
translated: “The wind element is soft and formless.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sman chen / de de bzhin te /
analyzed: sman chen / de de bzhin te /
translated: “Mahāmaudgalyāyana, it is so.

original: @162b ji ltar rlung gi khams snyi zhing lus med pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'di yang zhan cing lus med mod kyi lus chen po dag dang / chung ngu dag skyed par byed de /
analyzed: @162b ji ltar rlung gi khams snyi zhing lus med pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'di yang zhan cing lus med mod kyi lus chen po dag dang / chung ngu dag skyed par byed de /
translated: Just as the wind element is soft and formless, so too is this consciousness, which is weak and formless, and it produces large and small bodies.

original: sbrang bu'i yang rnam par shes pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: sbrang bu'i yang rnam par shes pa de nyid yin no //
translated: It is the same consciousness that is in a mosquito.

original: glang po che'i yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: glang po che'i yang de nyid yin no //
translated: The same is true of the elephant.

original: dper na / mar me'i me lce chung yang ra ba'am /
analyzed: dper na / mar me'i me lce chung yang ra ba'am /
translated: For example, a small flame can dispel the great darkness in a house or a cave.

original: khang pa'i nang gi mun pa chen po sel bar byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang lus len pa'i rgyu des na gzugs chung ngu dang / chen po rnams 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: khang pa'i nang gi mun pa chen po sel bar byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i khams 'dis kyang lus len pa'i rgyu des na gzugs chung ngu dang / chen po rnams 'grub par byed do //
translated: In the same way, this consciousness-element, by the cause of taking up a body, makes the small and great forms to be accomplished.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: Having spoken thus,

original: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Maheśvara said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci lags / de gzugs can zhig lags sam /🔽'on te gzugs ma mchis pa zhig lags /
analyzed: ci lags / de gzugs can zhig lags sam / 'on te gzugs ma mchis pa zhig lags /
translated: is it a form or is it formless?

original: rang bzhin ni ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ji lta bu lags /
translated: What is its nature?

original: rkyen ni ji lta bu dag las blta bar bgyi /
analyzed: rkyen ni ji lta bu dag las blta bar bgyi /
translated: By what conditions should it be seen?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sman chen / 'di la las rnams kyi spyod yul ni lha'i bde ba dag dang / 'byor pa dag dang / lha'i kha zas thob pa yin te /
analyzed: sman chen / 'di la las rnams kyi spyod yul ni lha'i bde ba dag dang / 'byor pa dag dang / lha'i kha zas thob pa yin te /
translated: “Maheśvara, in this case, the domain of the actions is the divine happiness, the divine wealth, and the divine food that is obtained.

original: dper na / mi dbul po gnyis shig 'brog tu 'khyam pa las /
analyzed: dper na / mi dbul po gnyis shig 'brog tu 'khyam pa las /
translated: For example, two poor men are wandering in the wilderness.

original: der gcig gis ni chu bsil ba rnyed la /
analyzed: der gcig gis ni chu bsil ba rnyed la /
translated: One of them finds cool water,

original: gcig ni skom ste shi na /🔽chu de la la zhig gis snyim pas bcus te /
analyzed: gcig ni skom ste shi na / chu de la la zhig gis snyim pas bcus te /
translated: but the other is thirsty and dies.

original: mi de la byin pa yang med /
analyzed: mi de la byin pa yang med /
translated: No one gives him water in a cupped hand.

original: la la zhig gis mi cig shos de la bkag pa yang med kyi /
analyzed: la la zhig gis mi cig shos de la bkag pa yang med kyi /
translated: No one stops the other man from drinking.

original: bsod nams kyi mthu 'ba' zhig gis gcig gis ni chu rnyed la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi mthu 'ba' zhig gis gcig gis ni chu rnyed la /
translated: But by the power of his own merit, one finds water,🔽and the other does not.

original: gcig gis ni ma rnyed pa de bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos de dag la blta bar bya'o //🔽zla ba yar gyi @163a *//
analyzed: gcig gis ni ma rnyed pa de bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos de dag la blta bar bya'o // zla ba yar gyi @163a *//
translated: In the same way, you should see those wholesome and unwholesome things.

original: ngo dang / mar gyi ngo ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngo dang / mar gyi ngo ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: You should see wholesome and unwholesome things as you see the waxing and waning moon.

original: dper na / shing tog rlon pa yongs su smin pa na /
analyzed: dper na / shing tog rlon pa yongs su smin pa na /
translated: For example, when a ripe fruit is fully ripe,

original: kha dog gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha dog gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: its color changes.

original: kha dog de dag dang yongs su smin pa yang me'i khams kyi dbang gis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha dog de dag dang yongs su smin pa yang me'i khams kyi dbang gis 'gyur ro //
translated: That color and its ripeness are due to the power of the fire element.

original: de bzhin du lus 'di yang bsod nams kyi dbang gis tshong dpon gyi khyim nor dang gser dang dngul dag tu rgyan nye bar ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus 'di yang bsod nams kyi dbang gis tshong dpon gyi khyim nor dang gser dang dngul dag tu rgyan nye bar ston to //
translated: In the same way, this body, by the power of merit, displays ornaments in the form of wealth, gold, and silver in the home of a merchant.

original: lha'i gnas dag tu lha'i rgyan dag nye bar ston te /
analyzed: lha'i gnas dag tu lha'i rgyan dag nye bar ston te /
translated: In the divine realms, it displays divine ornaments.

original: dbang phyug gi rgyan gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi dper bstan to //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi rgyan gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi dper bstan to //
translated: The ornaments of a powerful lord are taught as an example of merit.

original: dper na / sa bon sa la btab na /
analyzed: dper na / sa bon sa la btab na /
translated: For example, when a seed is planted in the ground,

original: shing gi rtse mor snang ba 'gyur la /🔽sa bon de yang sdong bu nas sdong bu'i rtse mor 'pho ba med cing /
analyzed: shing gi rtse mor snang ba 'gyur la / sa bon de yang sdong bu nas sdong bu'i rtse mor 'pho ba med cing /
translated: it appears at the top of the tree.🔽But that seed does not move from the stalk to the top of the tree.

original: shing gi nang na yang sa bon de mi dmigs la /
analyzed: shing gi nang na yang sa bon de mi dmigs la /
translated: And the seed is not perceived within the tree.

original: mi la la zhig gis lag pa gnyis kyis sa bon de blangs te /
analyzed: mi la la zhig gis lag pa gnyis kyis sa bon de blangs te /
translated: And no one takes that seed with both hands

original: shing gi rtse mor bzhag par yang med cing /
analyzed: shing gi rtse mor bzhag par yang med cing /
translated: and places it at the top of the tree.

original: sa bon rtsa ba nas 'pho ba yang mi dmigs pa de bzhin du las dge ba dang / mi dge ba lus la gnas pa rnams kyang lus la mi snang ngo //
analyzed: sa bon rtsa ba nas 'pho ba yang mi dmigs pa de bzhin du las dge ba dang / mi dge ba lus la gnas pa rnams kyang lus la mi snang ngo //
translated: And the seed is not perceived as moving from the root. In the same way, virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that reside in the body are not perceived in the body.

original: dper na / sa bon las me tog 'grub pa na /
analyzed: dper na / sa bon las me tog 'grub pa na /
translated: For example, when a flower is produced from a seed,

original: sa bon gyi nang na yang me tog mi snang zhing /
analyzed: sa bon gyi nang na yang me tog mi snang zhing /
translated: the flower is not seen within the seed.

original: me tog gi nang na yang 'bras bu mi dmigs la /
analyzed: me tog gi nang na yang 'bras bu mi dmigs la /
translated: Nor is the fruit seen within the flower.🔽And the seed and the flower are not two separate things.

original: sa bon dang me tog kyang gnyis su dbyer med pa de bzhin du lus las kyang las 'byung /
analyzed: sa bon dang me tog kyang gnyis su dbyer med pa de bzhin du lus las kyang las 'byung /
translated: In the same way, karma arises from the body,

original: las las kyang lus 'byung mod kyi /🔽lus kyi nang na las mi snang /
analyzed: las las kyang lus 'byung mod kyi / lus kyi nang na las mi snang /
translated: and the body arises from karma.🔽But karma is not seen within the body,

original: las kyi nang na yang lus mi snang ngo //
analyzed: las kyi nang na yang lus mi snang ngo //
translated: nor is the body seen within karma.

original: @163b dper na /
analyzed: @163b dper na /
translated: For example,

original: me tog yongs su smin pa na 'bras bu dmigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: me tog yongs su smin pa na 'bras bu dmigs pa de bzhin du /
translated: when a flower is fully developed, the fruit is seen.

original: lus smin na las rnams dmigs so //
analyzed: lus smin na las rnams dmigs so //
translated: In the same way, when the body is fully developed, karma is seen.🔽For example,

original: dper na / gang na sa bon gnas pa der me tog 'byung bar snang ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / gang na sa bon gnas pa der me tog 'byung bar snang ba de bzhin du /
translated: wherever a seed is planted, a flower is seen to grow.

original: lus 'di gang dang gang du skyes par gyur pa de dang der las dge ba dang / mi dge ba 'byung bar snang ste /
analyzed: lus 'di gang dang gang du skyes par gyur pa de dang der las dge ba dang / mi dge ba 'byung bar snang ste /
