original: pha ma khri gcig la 'dug cing phrad pas rnam par shes pa me tog de dag gi nang du 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha ma khri gcig la 'dug cing phrad pas rnam par shes pa me tog de dag gi nang du 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: the consciousness, through the union of the father and mother sitting on the one bed, mixes in the middle of those flowers.

original: yang der bdud rtsi 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i rlung ldang ste /
analyzed: yang der bdud rtsi 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i rlung ldang ste /
translated: Again, a wind called desirous of nectar arises there.

original: rlung des rnam par shes pa de zhag bdun @168b lon pa dang / lha gzhon nu rna cha gdub kor dri ma med cing 'gul ba dang ldan pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: rlung des rnam par shes pa de zhag bdun @168b lon pa dang / lha gzhon nu rna cha gdub kor dri ma med cing 'gul ba dang ldan pa 'grub par 'gyur ro // de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: After seven days, the wind will cause the consciousness to form into a young god with earrings, whose earrings are spotless and move.🔽After the Blessed One had spoken,

original: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana asked him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rnam par shes pa gzugs can ma lags pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis gzugs rnams ji ltar mngon par 'grub par bgyid /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzugs can ma lags pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis gzugs rnams ji ltar mngon par 'grub par bgyid /
translated: how do forms manifest due to the power of the conditions of nonphysical consciousness?

original: rkyen rnams la yang ji ltar gda' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rkyen rnams la yang ji ltar gda' bar 'gyur /
translated: How do the conditions appear?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sman chen / dper na /
analyzed: sman chen / dper na /
translated: “Mahāmaudgalyāyana, it is like this.

original: rlung gi khams gzugs med cing bstan du med pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis lha'i gnas dang / ri dang nags tshal la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rnams 'grub par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'di yang rkyen gyi dbang gis gzugs rnams 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: rlung gi khams gzugs med cing bstan du med pa'i rkyen gyi dbang gis lha'i gnas dang / ri dang nags tshal la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams rnams 'grub par byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'di yang rkyen gyi dbang gis gzugs rnams 'grub par byed do //
translated: Just as the formless and imperceptible wind element, by the power of conditions, causes the world systems of the abodes of the gods, mountains, forests, and so on to be established, in the same way, this consciousness, by the power of conditions, causes forms to be established.

original: sman chen / gzhan yang shing 'dzings pa gnyis phan tshun phrad de /
analyzed: sman chen / gzhan yang shing 'dzings pa gnyis phan tshun phrad de /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, two rubbing sticks are rubbed together

original: gcig la gcig drud cing gtsubs pa las me 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig drud cing gtsubs pa las me 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: and by the mutual contact of the two, fire is produced.

original: me de yang shing gi nang na mi snang la /
analyzed: me de yang shing gi nang na mi snang la /
translated: That fire is not seen in the wood,

original: shing med na yang me 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: shing med na yang me 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: and if there were no wood, fire would not occur.

original: me de yang rkyen gyi dbang gis shing las 'grub par 'gyur gyi rkyen med par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: me de yang rkyen gyi dbang gis shing las 'grub par 'gyur gyi rkyen med par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: That fire is produced from the wood by the power of conditions, not without conditions.

original: gzugs kyi dbang gis kyang shing gi nang na me mi snang la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi dbang gis kyang shing gi nang na me mi snang la /
translated: Also, by the power of form, fire is not seen in the wood,

original: shing ma gtogs pa yang me mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shing ma gtogs pa yang me mi dmigs so //
translated: and apart from the wood, fire is not observed.

original: sman chen / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa de yang pha ma'i dbang gis 'jug ste /
analyzed: sman chen / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa de yang pha ma'i dbang gis 'jug ste /
translated: Mahamati, in the same way, consciousness is activated by the power of the parents.

original: rnam par shes pa yang lus kyi nang na mi dmigs la /🔽lus med par rnam @169a *//
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang lus kyi nang na mi dmigs la / lus med par rnam @169a *//
translated: Consciousness is not perceived within the body,

original: par shes pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: par shes pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: and without the body, consciousness does not occur.

original: sman chen / dper na /
analyzed: sman chen / dper na /
translated: Mahamati, it is like this:

original: me ma byung bar gzugs dang / dro ba dang / kha dog gsal bar mi snang ngo //
analyzed: me ma byung bar gzugs dang / dro ba dang / kha dog gsal bar mi snang ngo //
translated: Without fire, form, heat, and light do not appear.

original: sman chen / de bzhin du lus ma grub par rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams mi snang ngo //
analyzed: sman chen / de bzhin du lus ma grub par rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams mi snang ngo //
translated: Mahamati, in the same way, without the body being formed, consciousness, feeling, perception, and mental formations do not appear.

original: sman chen / dper na /
analyzed: sman chen / dper na /
translated: Mahamati, it is like this:

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po gsal bar snang zhing /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor chen po gsal bar snang zhing /
translated: The great orb of the sun shines brightly,

original: gzi brjid kyis lam mer 'dug kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis nyi ma'i gzugs gnag gam /
analyzed: gzi brjid kyis lam mer 'dug kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis nyi ma'i gzugs gnag gam /
translated: and its splendor is radiant, yet ordinary foolish people do not see the form of the sun as black,🔽yellow, white,

original: ser ram / dkar ram /🔽dmar ser du mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: ser ram / dkar ram /🔽dmar ser du mi mthong ngo //
translated: or reddish-yellow.

original: sman chen / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa ni lta ba dang / nyan pa dang / snom pa dang / ro myang ba dang / reg pa'i rnam pa dag gis rtogs par 'gyur gyi /🔽lus la rnam par shes pa gnag pa'am /
analyzed: sman chen / de bzhin du rnam par shes pa ni lta ba dang / nyan pa dang / snom pa dang / ro myang ba dang / reg pa'i rnam pa dag gis rtogs par 'gyur gyi / lus la rnam par shes pa gnag pa'am /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, in the same way, consciousness is understood through the aspects of seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, and touching.🔽But the body is not seen as consciousness,

original: dkar ba'am / gzugs su snang bar mi sa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: dkar ba'am / gzugs su snang bar mi sa mi mthong ngo //
translated: nor is consciousness seen as having a form.

original: dper na / nyi ma tsha ba dang / ser ba dang / 'gro ba dang / phyir yang 'char ba dag gi rtags las snang ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rtags dag gis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / nyi ma tsha ba dang / ser ba dang / 'gro ba dang / phyir yang 'char ba dag gi rtags las snang ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang rtags dag gis blta bar bya'o //
translated: For example, light is seen through the signs of the sun, such as its heat, its yellow color, and its movement and reappearance. In the same way, consciousness should be seen through its signs.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal nas bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal nas bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When the Blessed One had said this, Mahāmaudgalyāyana said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rtags ji ltar blta bar bgyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rtags ji ltar blta bar bgyi /
translated: how should the signs of consciousness be seen?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Mahāmaudgalyāyana,

original: 'du byed kyi rtags dang / tshor ba'i rtags dang / 'du shes kyi rtags dang / sems pa dang / mya ngan dang / gdung ba dang / yid @169b mi bde ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rtags su blta'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rtags dang / tshor ba'i rtags dang / 'du shes kyi rtags dang / sems pa dang / mya ngan dang / gdung ba dang / yid @169b mi bde ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rtags su blta'o //
translated: The signs of volitional activity, the signs of sensation, the signs of conception, and the signs of intention, grief, sorrow, and mental unease are to be seen as the signs of consciousness.

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i bag chags 'di ltar dge bar nye bar 'gro ba'i sems dang / mi dge bar nye bar 'gro ba'i sems las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa'i bag chags 'di ltar dge bar nye bar 'gro ba'i sems dang / mi dge bar nye bar 'gro ba'i sems las blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the latent tendencies of consciousness should be seen in terms of the mind tending toward virtue and the mind tending toward nonvirtue.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: Having spoken thus,

original: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Maheśvara said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa lus las byung ste myur du skye ba yongs su len pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa lus las byung ste myur du skye ba yongs su len pa lags /
translated: how does consciousness emerge from the body and quickly take up rebirth?

original: rnam par shes pa lus las byung nas ma skyes shing yongs su ma bzung ba des ji ltar lus gzhan la gnas par bgyid /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lus las byung nas ma skyes shing yongs su ma bzung ba des ji ltar lus gzhan la gnas par bgyid /
translated: How does consciousness, having emerged from the body and not yet taken rebirth or been appropriated, come to abide in another body?

original: rnam par shes pa 'di ni ji ltar blta bar bgyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di ni ji ltar blta bar bgyi /
translated: How should I view this consciousness?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:🔽“Maheśvara,

original: sman chen / dper na /
analyzed: sman chen / dper na /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, it is like this:

original: mi la la lag pa ring zhing thur du brkyang la g-yul gyi go cha gyon te /
analyzed: mi la la lag pa ring zhing thur du brkyang la g-yul gyi go cha gyon te /
translated: Suppose a man with long arms, wearing armor,

original: lha'i rta rlung gi shugs dang 'dra bar mgyogs pa la zhon nas g-yul du 'gro ste /
analyzed: lha'i rta rlung gi shugs dang 'dra bar mgyogs pa la zhon nas g-yul du 'gro ste /
translated: mounted on a divine horse swift as the wind, were to go into battle.

original: de g-yul ngo der song nas /
analyzed: de g-yul ngo der song nas /
translated: Having gone into battle,

original: mdung dang / ral gri dang / mda' dag gis snying myos te /
analyzed: mdung dang / ral gri dang / mda' dag gis snying myos te /
translated: his heart would be confused by spears, swords, and arrows,

original: g-yul ngor rta'i mchog de las sa la lhung la /
analyzed: g-yul ngor rta'i mchog de las sa la lhung la /
translated: and he would fall from that excellent horse onto the ground in battle.

original: de yang lus kyis 'phong rtsal yongs su sbyangs pa zhig ste /
analyzed: de yang lus kyis 'phong rtsal yongs su sbyangs pa zhig ste /
translated: And he would be one who had fully trained his body in horsemanship,

original: myur ba myur bar sa las rta'i rgyab tu 'gong par byed na /
analyzed: myur ba myur bar sa las rta'i rgyab tu 'gong par byed na /
translated: and would quickly leap from the ground onto the horse’s back.

original: ji ltar mi de lhung nas rta zhon pa dang / 'gong che bas ji ltar rta nye bar gnas pa la rta la 'gong ba na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi de lhung nas rta zhon pa dang / 'gong che bas ji ltar rta nye bar gnas pa la rta la 'gong ba na /
translated: Just as that man, having fallen, would quickly mount the horse and, because of his skill, would mount the horse as it stands,

original: rta 'gro bzhin du 'gong pa chen pos 'gong bar byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rta 'gro bzhin du 'gong pa chen pos 'gong bar byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: so too should consciousness be seen.

original: ji ltar mi pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis 'jigs shing skrag @170a *//
analyzed: ji ltar mi pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis 'jigs shing skrag @170a *//
translated: Just as a man, frightened and terrified by the army of enemies, flees on horseback,

original: nas rta zhon te 'bros pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'dis thog ma shi 'phos nas lha'i dmigs pas yongs su zin cing /
analyzed: nas rta zhon te 'bros pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'dis thog ma shi 'phos nas lha'i dmigs pas yongs su zin cing /
translated: in the same way, this consciousness, having died and transmigrated, is seized by the object of the gods.

original: lha dang lha mo khri steng na 'dug pa mthong nas shin tu myur bar skye ba yongs su len to //
analyzed: lha dang lha mo khri steng na 'dug pa mthong nas shin tu myur bar skye ba yongs su len to //
translated: Seeing the gods and goddesses seated on thrones, it takes rebirth very quickly.

original: sman chen / gzhan yang dang po shi 'phos nas da dung ma skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa ji ltar blta bar bya zhes gang khyod kyis smras pa de ni /
analyzed: sman chen / gzhan yang dang po shi 'phos nas da dung ma skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa ji ltar blta bar bya zhes gang khyod kyis smras pa de ni /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, as for what you asked, “How should one view the aspect of consciousness that has died and transmigrated but has not yet taken rebirth?”

original: dper na / mi'i grib ma chu'i steng du bab pa gzugs su yang snang mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na / mi'i grib ma chu'i steng du bab pa gzugs su yang snang mod kyi /
translated: For example, the shadow of a human falls on the surface of the water and appears as a form.

original: de gzugs su gtogs par yang blta bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de gzugs su gtogs par yang blta bar mi bya'o //
translated: But it should not be viewed as belonging to form.

original: sman chen / dper na /
analyzed: sman chen / dper na /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, for example,

original: rkang lag mnyam pa dang ldan pa'i gzugs chu'i steng du bab pa de la ni dro ba'am /
analyzed: rkang lag mnyam pa dang ldan pa'i gzugs chu'i steng du bab pa de la ni dro ba'am /
translated: the form of a human with complete limbs that falls on the surface of the water is neither hot

original: grang ba'am / lus ngal bar 'gyur ba med cing /
analyzed: grang ba'am / lus ngal bar 'gyur ba med cing /
translated: nor cold, and the body does not tire.

original: lus de la ni sha'i dum bu yang med do //
analyzed: lus de la ni sha'i dum bu yang med do //
translated: There is no piece of flesh in that body.

original: grib ma de la ni khams kyis blangs pa yang med do //
analyzed: grib ma de la ni khams kyis blangs pa yang med do //
translated: There is no element in that shadow that is taken up.

original: mi'i gzugs brnyan chu'i nang du 'byung ba de las ni sdug bsngal ba'i sgra 'am /
analyzed: mi'i gzugs brnyan chu'i nang du 'byung ba de las ni sdug bsngal ba'i sgra 'am /
translated: From that reflection of a human form appearing in the water, there is no sound of suffering or

original: bde ba'i sgra 'byung ba yang med do //
analyzed: bde ba'i sgra 'byung ba yang med do //
translated: happiness that occurs.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang po shi 'phos nas lus kyi khog pa bor te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang po shi 'phos nas lus kyi khog pa bor te /
translated: In the same way, when the first consciousness transmigrates, having left the body’s cavity,

original: gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi rnam pa lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: it becomes like a reflection.

original: sman chen / de ltar na rnam par shes pa bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba ni lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba yongs su len par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman chen / de ltar na rnam par shes pa bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba ni lha rnams kyi nang du skye ba yongs su len par 'gyur ro //
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, in that way, consciousness that is directed toward merit takes up birth among the gods.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal nas bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal nas bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When the Blessed One had said that, Mahāmaudgalyāyana said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: rnam par shes pa sems @170b can dmyal ba rnams su ji ltar skye ba yongs su len pa lags /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sems @170b can dmyal ba rnams su ji ltar skye ba yongs su len pa lags /
translated: how does consciousness take up birth among hell beings?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Mahāmaudgalyāyana,

original: sman chen / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can ji ltar sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba yongs su len pa de nyon cig /
analyzed: sman chen / bsod nams ma yin par nye bar 'gro ba'i sems can ji ltar sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba yongs su len pa de nyon cig /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, listen to how sentient beings who are approaching non-merit take rebirth in the hells.

original: sman chen / 'di la sems can las mi dge bas yongs su zin pa de ni /
analyzed: sman chen / 'di la sems can las mi dge bas yongs su zin pa de ni /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, in this case, sentient beings who are seized by non-virtuous karma

original: sems can gyi ris nas 'chi 'pho ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris nas 'chi 'pho ste /
translated: die and transmigrate from the realm of sentient beings.

original: shi 'phos pa de 'di snyam du mi de ni nga nyid yin te /
analyzed: shi 'phos pa de 'di snyam du mi de ni nga nyid yin te /
translated: Having died and transmigrated, they think, “That person is me.

original: sems can dmyal ba 'di nas shi 'phos so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba 'di nas shi 'phos so //
translated: I have died and transmigrated from this hell.

original: 'di gnyis ni bdag gi pha ma yin no snyam du dran pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni bdag gi pha ma yin no snyam du dran pa skye'o //
translated: These two are my parents.” Such recollection arises.

original: shi 'phos pa de'i lus de ni tha mal pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shi 'phos pa de'i lus de ni tha mal pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi rnam pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: The body of that one who has died and transmigrated has the appearance of an ordinary physical nature.

original: yan lag skyes rnams kyang de dang 'dra ba nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: yan lag skyes rnams kyang de dang 'dra ba nyid du snang ngo //
translated: The limbs that are born appear in just that way.

original: dang po shi 'phos pa de mya ngan gyis g-yengs nas sems can dmyal ba sna tshogs snang ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: dang po shi 'phos pa de mya ngan gyis g-yengs nas sems can dmyal ba sna tshogs snang ba mthong ngo //
translated: First, that one who has died and transmigrated, agitated by grief, sees various appearances of hell beings.

original: rnam par shes pa dang po shi 'phos pa de'i las sems can dmyal ba dang 'brel par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang po shi 'phos pa de'i las sems can dmyal ba dang 'brel par 'gyur te /
translated: The first consciousness of the being who has died and transmigrated becomes connected with the hell realm.

original: phyogs kha gcig na ni sems can dmyal ba'i sa gzhi khrag gis gtor ba mthong nas de der chags pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs kha gcig na ni sems can dmyal ba'i sa gzhi khrag gis gtor ba mthong nas de der chags pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In one place, he sees the ground of the hell realm sprinkled with blood, and he develops attachment to it.

original: de chags par gyur nas sems can dmyal ba pa'i lus 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de chags par gyur nas sems can dmyal ba pa'i lus 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Once he has become attached, the body of the being in the hell realm is formed.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa des las kyi rkyen gyi dbang gis chu'i rjen shul shin tu rul cing mchog tu dri mi zhim pa mnam pa'i nang du lus skye ba yongs su len te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa des las kyi rkyen gyi dbang gis chu'i rjen shul shin tu rul cing mchog tu dri mi zhim pa mnam pa'i nang du lus skye ba yongs su len te /
translated: His consciousness, by the power of the condition of karma, takes up a body in the midst of a swamp of water that is extremely rotten and foul-smelling.

original: dper na / mi gtsang ba dang / ljan ljin mnam po'i rkyen gyis srin bu @171a *//
analyzed: dper na / mi gtsang ba dang / ljan ljin mnam po'i rkyen gyis srin bu @171a *//
translated: For example, due to the condition of a foul-smelling filth and garbage heap, insects

original: skye ba dang / dper na /
analyzed: skye ba dang / dper na /
translated: are born.

original: zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / chang mnam por gyur pa'i phyir srog chags skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / chang mnam por gyur pa'i phyir srog chags skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, due to the condition of foul-smelling curd, honey, and alcohol, living beings are born.🔽Mahāmaudgalyāyana, in the same way,

original: sman chen / de bzhin du sems can rnams /
analyzed: sman chen / de bzhin du sems can rnams /
translated: beings

original: sems can dmyal ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal nas bzang skyong gis thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de skad ces bka' stsal nas bzang skyong gis thal mo sbyar te /
translated: They will be born in the hells.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When the Blessed One had said this, Bhadrapāla put his palms together and said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi kha dog gi rnam pa ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi kha dog gi rnam pa ji lta bu lags /

original: lus kyi rnam pa ni ji lta bur 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa ni ji lta bur 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: What are their bodily forms like?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: bzang skyong / der khrag gi nang na skye ba gang yin pa de dag ni khrag gi mdog 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽chu klung rgal du med pa dag gi nang du skye ba gang yin pa de dag ni sprin sngon po'i kha dog ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzang skyong / der khrag gi nang na skye ba gang yin pa de dag ni khrag gi mdog 'dra bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro // chu klung rgal du med pa dag gi nang du skye ba gang yin pa de dag ni sprin sngon po'i kha dog ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Bhadrapāla, those born in blood will have a color like blood.🔽Those born in unfordable rivers will have the color of blue clouds.

original: ba tshva can gyi chu klung gi nang du skye ba gang yin pa de dag ni sha gzi gur 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba tshva can gyi chu klung gi nang du skye ba gang yin pa de dag ni sha gzi gur 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those born in rivers of caustic water will have the bodily form of a lump of flesh.

original: de dag gi lus ni rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu bde dgur rim gro byas pa ltar gzhon sha can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi lus ni rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu bde dgur rim gro byas pa ltar gzhon sha can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Their bodies will be like those of young princes, well-nourished and tender.

original: bzang skyong / de na de dag lus bong che bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de na de dag lus bong che bar 'gyur te /
translated: Bhadrapāla, their bodies will be huge.

original: mgo bo ma gtogs par khru brgyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgo bo ma gtogs par khru brgyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Except for their heads, they will be eight cubits tall.

original: sen mo ring zhing kha spu yod la spun por 'gyur zhing rkang lag mi sdug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sen mo ring zhing kha spu yod la spun por 'gyur zhing rkang lag mi sdug par 'gyur te /
translated: Their nails will be long, their beards and body hair coarse, and their hands and feet ugly.

original: gal te 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i mi sems can dmyal ba pa'i mi la ltar 'gro na /
analyzed: gal te 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i mi sems can dmyal ba pa'i mi la ltar 'gro na /
translated: If the people of Jambudvīpa were to go there, like the people in the hells,

original: mthong ma thag tu @171b 'chi ba'i chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu @171b 'chi ba'i chos dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: they would die immediately upon seeing them.

original: bzang skyong / gzhan yang sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kha zas za mod kyi /
analyzed: bzang skyong / gzhan yang sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kha zas za mod kyi /
translated: Bhadrapāla, moreover, although the beings in the hells do eat food,

original: de dag la bde bar 'gyur ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de dag la bde bar 'gyur ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: it does not bring them the slightest bit of happiness.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal nas bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal nas bcom ldan 'das la sman chen gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When the Blessed One had said this, Mahāmaudgalyāyana said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: sems can de dag kha zas ci 'tshal /
analyzed: sems can de dag kha zas ci 'tshal /
translated: what food do those beings eat?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sman chen / sems can dmyal ba de na de dag yongs su 'khyam la /
analyzed: sman chen / sems can dmyal ba de na de dag yongs su 'khyam la /
translated: “Mahāmaudgalyāyana, those beings wander in that hell,

original: shin tu rgyang ring ba nas zangs dang ra gan dmar por snang ba mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shin tu rgyang ring ba nas zangs dang ra gan dmar por snang ba mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: and from far away they see what appears to be copper and red brass.

original: de dag mthong nas kha zas kyi tshig rjod par byed de /🔽kha zas 'dod pa khyed tshur shog /
analyzed: de dag mthong nas kha zas kyi tshig rjod par byed de / kha zas 'dod pa khyed tshur shog /
translated: When they see it, they say, ‘Food!’

original: ces zer ro //
analyzed: ces zer ro //
translated: ‘Come here, you who want food!’

original: de dag kun nas 'phungs te /
analyzed: de dag kun nas 'phungs te /
translated: They rush there,🔽their cupped hands extended, and go to where the copper and brass are boiling.

original: snyim pa bzed nas zangs dang ra gan bskol ba ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas; snyim pa bzed cing zangs dang ra gan bskol ba'i kha zas de dag 'dod pas kha gdangs te /
analyzed: snyim pa bzed nas zangs dang ra gan bskol ba ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas; snyim pa bzed cing zangs dang ra gan bskol ba'i kha zas de dag 'dod pas kha gdangs te /
translated: They arrive, cupped hands extended, and with their mouths open, they want to eat the food that is the boiling copper and brass.

original: zangs dang ra gan za bar byed do //🔽de dag zangs dang ra gan rab tu 'bar ba des /
analyzed: zangs dang ra gan za bar byed do // de dag zangs dang ra gan rab tu 'bar ba des /
translated: They eat the copper and brass.🔽The burning, blazing copper and brass

original: su ru rur rab tu 'bar zhing khog pa 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: su ru rur rab tu 'bar zhing khog pa 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: burns their insides and blazes there.

original: sman chen / de dag kha zas 'dra bas bslus nas sdug bsngal shin tu che ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman chen / de dag kha zas 'dra bas bslus nas sdug bsngal shin tu che ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, they are deceived by food that is like poison and experience extremely great suffering.

original: sman chen / sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag gi rnam par shes pa de rus pa'i lus dag la gnas par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sman chen / sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag gi rnam par shes pa de rus pa'i lus dag la gnas par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the consciousness of those hell beings remains in their bony bodies,

original: rus pa'i tshogs dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /🔽sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag rnam @172a *//
analyzed: rus pa'i tshogs dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te / sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can de dag rnam @172a *//
translated: and they do not separate from their heaps of bones.

original: par shes pa dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par shes pa dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir 'chi ba'i dus byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, because those hell beings do not separate from consciousness, they do not die.

original: de dag bru ba tsha bas gzir bzhin du de na kha zas kyi bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: de dag bru ba tsha bas gzir bzhin du de na kha zas kyi bya ba yang med do //
translated: They are tormented by the burning pain of hunger, and there is no food to be had.

original: de na lha'i skyed mos tshal shing ljon pa brgya phrag mang po me tog shin tu rgyas pa dag dang / gsing ma sngon po yangs pa'i sa phyogs dag kyang yod par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de na lha'i skyed mos tshal shing ljon pa brgya phrag mang po me tog shin tu rgyas pa dag dang / gsing ma sngon po yangs pa'i sa phyogs dag kyang yod par mthong ngo //
translated: There are divine parks there, with many hundreds of trees in full bloom, and vast areas of blue-green grass.

original: de dag gis skyed mos tshal de dag mthong nas yid rab tu dga' ste /
analyzed: de dag gis skyed mos tshal de dag mthong nas yid rab tu dga' ste /
translated: When they see those parks, they are very happy.

original: 'di skad du grogs po dag /
analyzed: 'di skad du grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends, come here!

original: skyed mos tshal 'di na reg na bde ba'i ser bu ldang ba yod kyi tshur shog /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal 'di na reg na bde ba'i ser bu ldang ba yod kyi tshur shog /
translated: There is a breeze in this park that is pleasant to the touch.

original: ces zer te de dag 'dus nas /
analyzed: ces zer te de dag 'dus nas /
translated: ” They gather together

original: myur ba myur bar skyed mos tshal de'i nang du 'gro'o //
analyzed: myur ba myur bar skyed mos tshal de'i nang du 'gro'o //
translated: and quickly enter the park.

original: de dag de'i nang du song nas yud tsam zhig bde ba'i 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: de dag de'i nang du song nas yud tsam zhig bde ba'i 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: Once they are inside, they feel happy for a short while.

original: de dag gi shing de dag las byung ba'i me tog de dag dang / lo ma de dag ral grir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi shing de dag las byung ba'i me tog de dag dang / lo ma de dag ral grir 'gyur te /
translated: Then the flowers and leaves that come from those trees turn into swords.

original: ral gri de dag gis yan lag gcod cing gshegs par byed de /
analyzed: ral gri de dag gis yan lag gcod cing gshegs par byed de /
translated: Those swords cut and pierce their limbs.

original: de dag ral gris bcad nas nyams thag pa'i sgra chen po 'byin par byed cing phyogs phyogs su 'byer ro //
analyzed: de dag ral gris bcad nas nyams thag pa'i sgra chen po 'byin par byed cing phyogs phyogs su 'byer ro //
translated: When they are cut by the swords, they cry out in distress and flee in all directions.

original: de dag 'byer ba na yang rang gi las las byung ba'i gshin rje'i mi'i lag na sog le dang / tho ba thogs shing so dang bzhin bsgyur la /
analyzed: de dag 'byer ba na yang rang gi las las byung ba'i gshin rje'i mi'i lag na sog le dang / tho ba thogs shing so dang bzhin bsgyur la /
translated: Even as they flee, the henchmen of Yamarāja, who have arisen from their own karma, appear with saws and hammers in their hands.🔽Their teeth and faces are distorted.

original: skra 'bar zhing lus 'bar ba'i phreng bas g-yogs la /
analyzed: skra 'bar zhing lus 'bar ba'i phreng bas g-yogs la /
translated: Their hair is ablaze, and their bodies are covered with garlands of flames.

original: mtshon cha gzas pa dag phyi bzhin du sgra 'byin cing 'di skad du /
analyzed: mtshon cha gzas pa dag phyi bzhin du sgra 'byin cing 'di skad du /
translated: The weapons that are wielded make a sound as they follow behind, saying:

original: khyed cag sdod cig da gar 'bros /🔽khyed rang gi las kyis @172b bsgrubs pa'i tshal 'di nyams su myong bar gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed cag sdod cig da gar 'bros / khyed rang gi las kyis @172b bsgrubs pa'i tshal 'di nyams su myong bar gyis shig /
translated: “You must stay here. Do not run away.

original: ces zer te /
analyzed: ces zer te /
translated: Experience this forest that you have created through your own karma.”

original: sman chen / de ltar na sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams skyo ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman chen / de ltar na sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams skyo ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in this way the beings in the hells become disillusioned.

original: sman chen / gzhan yang zhag bdun lon nas sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyis las nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sman chen / gzhan yang zhag bdun lon nas sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyis las nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, after seven days the beings in the hells experience the ripening of their karma.

original: bung ba me tog la 'pho ba bzhin du dngos po sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyi dbang gis rnam par shes pa sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba yongs su len to //
analyzed: bung ba me tog la 'pho ba bzhin du dngos po sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyi dbang gis rnam par shes pa sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba yongs su len to //
translated: Like bees moving from flower to flower, their consciousnesses take rebirth in the hells due to the power of various conditions.

original: de yang dang po shi 'phos nas dbang med par khrid de /
analyzed: de yang dang po shi 'phos nas dbang med par khrid de /
translated: First, after death, they are helplessly led

original: sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bar gyur nas mun pa mun nag chen por zhugs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bar gyur nas mun pa mun nag chen por zhugs te /
translated: into great darkness, suffering and mental anguish.

original: mi rgod kyis khrid pa bzhin du 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: mi rgod kyis khrid pa bzhin du 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks,

original: kye hud / da ni bdag 'dzam bu'i gling rnam par bkra pa bor te gnyen sdug pa yongs su spangs nas; sems can dmyal ba dag tu mngon du gnas par gyur cing 'dug ci gu /
analyzed: kye hud / da ni bdag 'dzam bu'i gling rnam par bkra pa bor te gnyen sdug pa yongs su spangs nas; sems can dmyal ba dag tu mngon du gnas par gyur cing 'dug ci gu /
translated: “Alas, I am now leaving the beautiful land of Jambudvīpa, abandoning my dear relatives, and am going to dwell in the hells.”

original: da ni mtho ris kyi lam mi mthong ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: da ni mtho ris kyi lam mi mthong ngo snyam mo //
translated: “I will not see the path to the higher realms.”

original: der yang dar gyi srin bu rgyud gcig gis dkris pa bzhin du shin tu myur bar skye ba yongs su len te /
analyzed: der yang dar gyi srin bu rgyud gcig gis dkris pa bzhin du shin tu myur bar skye ba yongs su len te /
translated: He is born there as quickly as a silk worm is enclosed in its cocoon.

original: de yang bdag nyid kyi mgul nas zhags pas btags par shes so //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid kyi mgul nas zhags pas btags par shes so //
translated: He knows that he is bound by the noose around his neck.

original: bzang skyong / de ltar na sems can dmyal bar sems can rnams su skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de ltar na sems can dmyal bar sems can rnams su skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, sentient beings are born in the hells in this way.

original: de ltar na de dag la rgyu'i bye brag dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag la rgyu'i bye brag dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the specific causes for this come into being.”

original: de nas bzang skyong spu zing zhes byed nas thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas bzang skyong spu zing zhes byed nas thal mo sbyar te /
translated: Then Bhadrapāla’s hair stood on end. He put his palms together

original: bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la skyabs su song ngo //
translated: and took refuge in the Blessed One.

original: rgyal po'i @173a *//
analyzed: rgyal po'i @173a *//
translated: The king

original: bu gzhon nu sman chen gyis kyang 'di skad du dam pa'i chos mnyan ba 'dis na bdag 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe log par ltung ba'i chos can du ma gyur cig /
analyzed: bu gzhon nu sman chen gyis kyang 'di skad du dam pa'i chos mnyan ba 'dis na bdag 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe log par ltung ba'i chos can du ma gyur cig /
translated: The young man Mahāmaudgalyāyana also made this aspiration: “By listening to the sublime Dharma, may I not be subject to falling into wrong ways while I am wandering in saṃsāra.

original: bdag sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba yongs su len par ma gyur cig /🔽ces smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: bdag sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye ba yongs su len par ma gyur cig / ces smon lam btab bo //
translated: May I not take rebirth in the hells.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la bzang skyong gis 'di skad gsol to; ;yang bcom ldan 'das la bdag zhu ba zhu'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la bzang skyong gis 'di skad gsol to; ;yang bcom ldan 'das la bdag zhu ba zhu'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then Bhadrapāla said to the Blessed One, “Blessed One, I have another question for you.”

original: bzang skyong khyod ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig /
analyzed: bzang skyong khyod ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Bhadrapāla, ask whatever you wish.”

original: bzang skyong gis gsol pa /
analyzed: bzang skyong gis gsol pa /
translated: Bhadrapāla said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: bsags pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: bsags pa ni gang lags /
translated: what is accumulation?

original: spungs pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: spungs pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is a heap?

original: phung po rnams ni gang lags /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni gang lags /
translated: What are the aggregates?

original: 'pho ba ni gang lags /
analyzed: 'pho ba ni gang lags /
translated: What is transference?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: bzang skyong / 'di la khams phrad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzang skyong / 'di la khams phrad pa'i phyir /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, here, because of the meeting of the elements,

original: khams bzhi po dag gis lus 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: khams bzhi po dag gis lus 'grub par byed de /
translated: The four elements form the body.

original: shes rab dang / lta ba dang / yid dang / ma rig pa dang / khams dang / spyod yul dang / rnam par shes pa rnams ni bsags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang / lta ba dang / yid dang / ma rig pa dang / khams dang / spyod yul dang / rnam par shes pa rnams ni bsags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Wisdom, view, mind, ignorance, elements, objects, and consciousness are called “accumulations.”

original: de la sbungs pa ni khams drug po nyid dang / skye mched kyi spyod yul drug dang / khams kyi rang bzhin gsum dang / skye mched len pa'i rgyu gnyis dang / skra dang / kha spu dang / sen mo dang / ba spu dang /
analyzed: de la sbungs pa ni khams drug po nyid dang / skye mched kyi spyod yul drug dang / khams kyi rang bzhin gsum dang / skye mched len pa'i rgyu gnyis dang / skra dang / kha spu dang / sen mo dang / ba spu dang /
translated: Among them, “heap” refers to the six elements themselves, the six objects of the sense bases, the three natures of the elements, the two causes of grasping the sense bases, and the collection of hair, facial hair, nails, body hair,🔽skin, flesh, pus, bile, phlegm, mucus, fat, lymph, arms, legs, eyes, major and minor body parts.

original: pags pa dang / sha dang / rnag dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / snabs dang / tshil dang / chu ser dang / rkang @173b lag dang / mig dang / yan lag dang / nying lag tshogs la spungs zhes bya'o //🔽dper na / 'bru spungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: pags pa dang / sha dang / rnag dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / snabs dang / tshil dang / chu ser dang / rkang @173b lag dang / mig dang / yan lag dang / nying lag tshogs la spungs zhes bya'o //🔽dper na / 'bru spungs pa bzhin te /
translated: It is called a “heap” because it is like a heap of grains.

original: nas dang / til dang / gro dang / mon sran sde'u mang po la spungs pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du lus kyi yan lag dang / nying lag tu gtogs pa tshogs pa la spungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nas dang / til dang / gro dang / mon sran sde'u mang po la spungs pa zhes bya ba de bzhin du lus kyi yan lag dang / nying lag tu gtogs pa tshogs pa la spungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as a heap of barley, a heap of sesame seeds, a heap of wheat, or a heap of beans is spoken of, in the same way, a collection of the parts and members of the body is called a “heap.”

original: khams drug po de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams drug po de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six elements?

original: de la sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: They are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element.

original: skye mched drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye mched drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six sense bases?

original: 'di la mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya'o //
translated: They are the eye sense base, the ear sense base, the nose sense base, the tongue sense base, the body sense base, and the thinking-mind sense base.

original: skye mched kyi spyod yul drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye mched kyi spyod yul drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six sense objects?

original: 'di la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi skye mched ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos kyi skye mched ces bya ba ste /
translated: They are the form sense object, the sound sense object, the smell sense object, the taste sense object, the tangible sense object, and the entity sense object.

original: de dag ni spyod yul drug yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni spyod yul drug yin no //
translated: These are the six sense objects.

original: de la khams kyi rang bzhin gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la khams kyi rang bzhin gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three natures of the elements?

original: 'di la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ces bya ba'o //
translated: They are called desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: de la de dag nyid kyi kun nas ldang ba gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de dag nyid kyi kun nas ldang ba gsum gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the three kinds of mental afflictions?

original: rlung dang / mkhris pa dang; bad kan rnams so //
analyzed: rlung dang / mkhris pa dang; bad kan rnams so //
translated: They are wind, bile, and phlegm.

original: de la skye mched len pa'i rgyu gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la skye mched len pa'i rgyu gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the two causes of the appropriation of the sense sources?

original: 'di la tshul khrims dang / dad pa dang / gtong ba dang / nor dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la tshul khrims dang / dad pa dang / gtong ba dang / nor dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called morality, faith, generosity, wealth, diligence, concentration, virtue, and nonvirtue.

original: de la phung po zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phung po zhes bya ba'i don gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the meaning of the term ‘aggregate’?

original: 'di la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are called feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni @174a *//
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni @174a *//
translated: These four

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po rnams so //
translated: are the formless aggregates.

original: de la tshor ba ni myong ba'o //
analyzed: de la tshor ba ni myong ba'o //
translated: “Feeling is experience.

original: 'du shes ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni shes pa'o //
translated: Perception is cognition.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'du byed rnams so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'du byed rnams so //
translated: Happiness and suffering are formations.

original: blta ba dang; nyan pa dang / snom pa dang / ro myang ba dang / reg bya rnams rig pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: blta ba dang; nyan pa dang / snom pa dang / ro myang ba dang / reg bya rnams rig pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, and touching are consciousness.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pas na lus la dbang ba'i dbang phyug dang / len pa dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi khongs su gtogs pas na lus la dbang ba'i dbang phyug dang / len pa dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: Since it includes all things, it is the lord of the body and is in accord with appropriation.

original: de la 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims shin tu yongs su dag pa dang / lus dang ngag gi las kyi 'bras bu thob pa'i 'chi ba'i dus byed pa gang yin pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa des phung po rnams yongs su btang nas /
analyzed: de la 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims shin tu yongs su dag pa dang / lus dang ngag gi las kyi 'bras bu thob pa'i 'chi ba'i dus byed pa gang yin pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa des phung po rnams yongs su btang nas /
translated: “Transmigration” refers to the time when one’s discipline is completely pure and one’s body and speech are about to die and give up the results of their actions. At that time, consciousness gives up the aggregates,

original: yang srid par mi skye zhing phyir mi ldog pas na shin tu bde bar 'pho zhing 'gro ste /
analyzed: yang srid par mi skye zhing phyir mi ldog pas na shin tu bde bar 'pho zhing 'gro ste /
translated: and because one is not reborn in any other existence and does not return, one transmigrates and goes to a place of complete happiness.

original: 'phos pa de'i phyir yang 'pho ba can ma yin pa de lta bu ni de'i 'pho bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'phos pa de'i phyir yang 'pho ba can ma yin pa de lta bu ni de'i 'pho bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because of that transmigration, one does not transmigrate again. That is the transmigration of such a one.

original: de nas bzang skyong dang / sman chen gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas /
analyzed: de nas bzang skyong dang / sman chen gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la gtugs nas /
translated: Then Bhadrapāla and Mahāmaudgalyāyana touched their heads to the Bhagavān’s feet.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pas sems can rnams tshim par bgyid pa gang lags pa'i chos kyi tshogs 'di legs par gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pas sems can rnams tshim par bgyid pa gang lags pa'i chos kyi tshogs 'di legs par gsungs so //
translated: “Lord, the Tathāgata has well taught this Dharma-aggregate which satisfies sentient beings with omniscience.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said:

original: bzang skyong / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'di ni bcos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bzang skyong / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'di ni bcos pa ma yin te /
translated: “Bhadrapāla, this knowledge of the Tathāgata is not fabricated.

original: 'di'i rang bzhin ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Its nature is not known to be omniscience.

original: shes rab kyi snang ba @174b 'di ni dka' ba spyad pa brgya stong du mas bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba @174b 'di ni dka' ba spyad pa brgya stong du mas bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: This light of wisdom is accomplished by many hundreds of thousands of austerities.

original: 'di ni ngas ji skad bstan pa de kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ngas ji skad bstan pa de kho na bzhin no //
translated: It is just as I have taught it.

original: chos kyi nyi ma thams cad mkhyen pa nyid snang bar byed pa /
analyzed: chos kyi nyi ma thams cad mkhyen pa nyid snang bar byed pa /
translated: The sun of the Dharma illuminates omniscience.

original: yon tan gyi grags pa rgyas par byed pa /
analyzed: yon tan gyi grags pa rgyas par byed pa /
translated: It spreads the fame of good qualities.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho'i mdzod /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho'i mdzod /
translated: It is the treasure-house of the ocean of omniscient knowledge.

original: sems can rnams kyi rgyud 'dul bar byed pa /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rgyud 'dul bar byed pa /
translated: It disciplines the mind-streams of sentient beings.

original: 'dul ba ston pa 'di yul gang na gnas sam /
analyzed: 'dul ba ston pa 'di yul gang na gnas sam /
translated: In which country is this teaching of the Vinaya being taught?

original: de ston par 'gyur ba der ni mi ma yin pa rnams srung bar byed de /
analyzed: de ston par 'gyur ba der ni mi ma yin pa rnams srung bar byed de /
translated: The non-humans will protect that place where it is being taught.

original: lha dang / lha ma yin dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams phyag bya ba'i phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang / lha ma yin dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams phyag bya ba'i phyir 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods, asuras, and mahoragas will come to pay homage.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / gzhan dag la yang rgya cher rab tu ston pa gang yin pa de la ni mtshon gyi 'jigs pa byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / gzhan dag la yang rgya cher rab tu ston pa gang yin pa de la ni mtshon gyi 'jigs pa byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: For those who uphold this Dharma discourse, who hold it, read it, master it, and extensively teach it to others, there will be no fear of weapons.

original: dug gi 'jigs pa byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dug gi 'jigs pa byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: There will be no fear of poison.

original: me'i 'jigs pa dang / rgyal po dang / chu dang / chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me'i 'jigs pa dang / rgyal po dang / chu dang / chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There will be no fear of fire, of the king, of water, or of robbers.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Bhikṣus,

original: khyed kyis deng phan chad ma dad pa rnams la bshad par mi bya'o; ;klan ka tshol ba rnams la ma yin /
analyzed: khyed kyis deng phan chad ma dad pa rnams la bshad par mi bya'o; ;klan ka tshol ba rnams la ma yin /
translated: from now on you should not teach this to those who lack faith, to those who seek to find fault,

original: gcer bu pa rnams la ma yin /
analyzed: gcer bu pa rnams la ma yin /
translated: to the Nirgranthas,

original: gcer bu pa'i nyan thos rnams la ma yin /🔽gnas gzhan la zhugs pa la bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gcer bu pa'i nyan thos rnams la ma yin / gnas gzhan la zhugs pa la bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: not to the disciples of the Nirgranthas,🔽nor to those who have entered other schools.

original: ma dris par yang bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma dris par yang bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not explain it to those who have not asked about it.

original: de bas na gal te la 'khrul par gyur na /
analyzed: de bas na gal te la 'khrul par gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if one makes a mistake,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la la 'khrul pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la la 'khrul pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will have committed an error with regard to the Tathāgata.

original: dge slong ngam /🔽khyim na gnas pa gang la las 'di @175a *//
analyzed: dge slong ngam / khyim na gnas pa gang la las 'di @175a *//
translated: Whether a monk🔽or a layperson, whoever understands

original: rtogs pa de ni phyag bya ba'i gnas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtogs pa de ni phyag bya ba'i gnas su 'gyur te /
translated: this will be worthy of homage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bya ba bzhin du gus pa bskyed par bya zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bya ba bzhin du gus pa bskyed par bya zhing /
translated: One should generate respect for them as one would for the Tathāgata.

original: 'di ni mdzod 'dzin pa yin no; ;snyam du bzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mdzod 'dzin pa yin no; ;snyam du bzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should think, ‘This is the one who holds the treasury.’

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gzung zhig /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gzung zhig /
translated: you should uphold this Dharma discourse,

original: chongs shig / lhogs shig /
analyzed: chongs shig / lhogs shig /
translated: remember it,

original: shod cig / gzhan dag la yang rgya cher rab tu ston cig /
analyzed: shod cig / gzhan dag la yang rgya cher rab tu ston cig /
translated: recite it, explain it, and teach it widely to others.🔽” Ānanda said:

original: kun dga' bos gsol pa /
analyzed: kun dga' bos gsol pa /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽what is the name of this Dharma discourse?🔽How should I remember it?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gzung bar 'tshal na; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di gzung bar 'tshal na; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: if I wish to uphold this Dharma discourse,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags /
translated: Blessed One, what is the name of this Dharma discourse?

original: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi /
translated: How should I remember it?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: Ānanda,

original: de'i phyir khyod kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di rnam par shes pa 'pho ba zhes bya bar gzung zhig /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di rnam par shes pa 'pho ba zhes bya bar gzung zhig /
translated: therefore you should remember this Dharma discourse as 'The Transference of Consciousness.'

original: bzang skyong gis zhus pa zhes bya bar yang gzung zhig /
analyzed: bzang skyong gis zhus pa zhes bya bar yang gzung zhig /
translated: You should also remember it as 'The Questions of Bhadrapāla.'

original: brtsam par bya zhing dbyung bar bya //
analyzed: brtsam par bya zhing dbyung bar bya //
translated: One should undertake and exert oneself,

original: sangs rgyas bstan la 'jug par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan la 'jug par bya //
translated: and enter the Buddha's teachings.

original: 'dam bu'i khyim la glang chen bzhin //
analyzed: 'dam bu'i khyim la glang chen bzhin //
translated: Like an elephant on a house of reeds,

original: 'chi bdag sde 'di gzhom par bya //
analyzed: 'chi bdag sde 'di gzhom par bya //
translated: one should conquer the army of the Lord of Death.

original: gang zhig rab tu bag yod par //
analyzed: gang zhig rab tu bag yod par //
translated: Whoever practices with carefulness

original: chos 'dul 'di la spyod gyur pa //
analyzed: chos 'dul 'di la spyod gyur pa //
translated: in this Dharma and Vinaya,

original: skye ba'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor ba rab spangs nas //
translated: having abandoned the cycle of birth,

original: sdug bsngal mtha' mar 'byin par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mtha' mar 'byin par 'gyur //
translated: will put an end to suffering.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One having spoken thus,

original: rgyal bu gzhon nu sman chen dang / tshong dpon @175b bzang skyong dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
analyzed: rgyal bu gzhon nu sman chen dang / tshong dpon @175b bzang skyong dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
translated: the young prince Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the merchant Bhadrapāla, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, garuḍas, and gandharvas rejoiced.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //🔽'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs ba chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do // 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs ba chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs le'u stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: They praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: tshong dpon bzang skyong gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshong dpon bzang skyong gis zhus pa'i le'u zhes bya ste /
translated: This was the thirty-ninth chapter, “The Questions of the Merchant Bhadrapāla,” of “The Dharma Discourses of the Great Heap of Jewels.”🔽The Questions of the Merchant Bhadrapāla

original: sum cu rtsa dgu pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: sum cu rtsa dgu pa rdzogs so ////
translated: is completed.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / su rendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo tstsha ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / su rendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo tstsha ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa //
translated: The Indian preceptors Jinamitra and Surendrabodhi and the translator-editor, the venerable monk Yeshé Dé, translated and finalized this text.
